Job Title: Director of Financial Planning and Analysis
Job Description:
Who Are We? QinetiQ Inc. is a leading innovator with over 25 years of experience rapidly developing advanced C5ISR sensor solutions and is a renowned world leader in robotics and autonomy. The combined QinetiQ U.S.

business unit brings capabilities across the full lifecycle of technology development from applied research and development to rapid prototyping, testing, fielding, and sustainment. Our expertise with unmanned platforms, broad sensing modalities, and cross-domain interoperability ensures that we deliver integrated solutions for Warfighter dominance in all phases of combat. We are a world-class team of professionals who deliver next generation technology and products in robotic and autonomous platforms and systems, ground systems, soldier systems, maritime systems, airborne sensors and payloads, processing and exploitation capabilities, and integrated C2 solutions. Much of our work contributes to innovative research in ﬁelds such as sensor science, signal processing, data fusion, artiﬁcial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML), and augmented reality (AR).

Our customers are always our number one priority and we consistently deliver Mission-Led Innovation to empower and protect our Defense and Security forces in the U.S. and abroad. QinetiQ Inc. C5ISR Solutions is looking for an experienced, colloborative financial professional to lead our financial planning & analysis function.

In this role the Director of Financial Planning & Analysis will contribute to our mission by doing the following: Your Contribution to Our Mission: Prepare annual profit and loss (" P& L"), indirect cost budgets, quarterly P&L forecasts and periodic indirect cost forecasts. Perform monthly reporting of actual versus budgeted performance of P&L, balance sheet and cash flow and supporting variance analysis (include in g program-level drivers). Prepare monthly indirect cost reports and variance to budget analysis for department heads and senior management. Conduct monthly reviews and quarterly executive reviews of same.

Ensure accurate monthly program-level budgeting for use by program managers and baseline input to business forecasts. Ensure appropriate revenue recognition for various contract types, including profit accrual. Prepare monthly funded and unfunded backlog reports. Provide program funding requirements to Program Offices and prepare the financial analysis required for work-at-risk request form on a timely basis.

Participate in annual strategic planning process, including development of estimating models and preparation of summary financial estimates. Prepare financial data and appropriate variance comments for presentation to the board of directors in addition to coordination/preparation of the board booklet. Scrutinize the indirect rate performance as part of monthly closing process and conduct monthly management meetings to discuss indirect cost performance versus budget. To Land This Job, You Need: 8-10+ years of work experience in financial planning & analysis, accounting, consulting, and/or corporate finance.

Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or Finance required, MBA is a plus. Exceptional financial modeling skills. Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy. Excellent analytical abilities, problem-solving skills and business acumen.

Exceptional written and verbal communications skills. Excellent project and time management abilities. Ability to work under pressure within short time constraints. Ability to effectively interact with all levels of management on financial related issues.

Strong Ability and clearly articulate financial material and analytics and provide guidance to leadership acting as a business partner. Job Type: Full Time Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain : DOD Secret Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain: DOD Secret Why QinetiQ Inc.? Your work will contribute to the protection of American Warfighters and Security Forces. Opportunity to work with cutting edge technology.

Extensive opportunities for continuous learning, professional growth and advancement. We only hire the best! No matter if you are entry or senior level, you will have the opportunity learn from some of the best in the industry. We have fun!

We regularly have company events, from luncheons and costume contests to golf tournaments. We care about YOU and YOUR FAMILY. We offer competitive benefits and health insurance options. No One Has Time for Long Job Applications!

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

WHAT YOU'LL DO

The Northeast System is the largest system globally for BCG, consisting of six offices within the North America region: Boston, New York, New Jersey, Philadelphia, Pittsburgh, Washington DC. This role also includes our US federal government practice (Fed).

As a senior member of the Northeast system finance team, the FPA manager provides support to system leadership, office leadership, system partners, consulting and business services team. They will interact regularly with Managing Directors and Partners (MDPs) and other members of senior consulting staff.

In addition, you will be connected throughout BCG matrix informing internal functions about outlook and provide decision support to help make informed decisions. This includes building and managing a team of analyst that is fostering relationships across local offices, shared services, regional functions, SBU’s and global services, driving discussions, anticipating needs, providing insight, fielding adhoc analysis and data requests.

Job Title: Director of Financial Planning and Analysis
Job Description:
Who Are We? QinetiQ Inc. is a leading innovator with over 25 years of experience rapidly developing advanced C5ISR sensor solutions and is a renowned world leader in robotics and autonomy. The combined QinetiQ U.S.

business unit brings capabilities across the full lifecycle of technology development from applied research and development to rapid prototyping, testing, fielding, and sustainment. Our expertise with unmanned platforms, broad sensing modalities, and cross-domain interoperability ensures that we deliver integrated solutions for Warfighter dominance in all phases of combat. We are a world-class team of professionals who deliver next generation technology and products in robotic and autonomous platforms and systems, ground systems, soldier systems, maritime systems, airborne sensors and payloads, processing and exploitation capabilities, and integrated C2 solutions. Much of our work contributes to innovative research in ﬁelds such as sensor science, signal processing, data fusion, artiﬁcial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML), and augmented reality (AR).

Our customers are always our number one priority and we consistently deliver Mission-Led Innovation to empower and protect our Defense and Security forces in the U.S. and abroad. QinetiQ Inc. C5ISR Solutions is looking for an experienced, colloborative financial professional to lead our financial planning & analysis function.

In this role the Director of Financial Planning & Analysis will contribute to our mission by doing the following: Your Contribution to Our Mission: Prepare annual profit and loss (" P& L"), indirect cost budgets, quarterly P&L forecasts and periodic indirect cost forecasts. Perform monthly reporting of actual versus budgeted performance of P&L, balance sheet and cash flow and supporting variance analysis (include in g program-level drivers). Prepare monthly indirect cost reports and variance to budget analysis for department heads and senior management. Conduct monthly reviews and quarterly executive reviews of same.

Ensure accurate monthly program-level budgeting for use by program managers and baseline input to business forecasts. Ensure appropriate revenue recognition for various contract types, including profit accrual. Prepare monthly funded and unfunded backlog reports. Provide program funding requirements to Program Offices and prepare the financial analysis required for work-at-risk request form on a timely basis.

Participate in annual strategic planning process, including development of estimating models and preparation of summary financial estimates. Prepare financial data and appropriate variance comments for presentation to the board of directors in addition to coordination/preparation of the board booklet. Scrutinize the indirect rate performance as part of monthly closing process and conduct monthly management meetings to discuss indirect cost performance versus budget. To Land This Job, You Need: 8-10+ years of work experience in financial planning & analysis, accounting, consulting, and/or corporate finance.

Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or Finance required, MBA is a plus. Exceptional financial modeling skills. Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy. Excellent analytical abilities, problem-solving skills and business acumen.

Exceptional written and verbal communications skills. Excellent project and time management abilities. Ability to work under pressure within short time constraints. Ability to effectively interact with all levels of management on financial related issues.

Strong Ability and clearly articulate financial material and analytics and provide guidance to leadership acting as a business partner. Job Type: Full Time Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain : DOD Secret Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain: DOD Secret Why QinetiQ Inc.? Your work will contribute to the protection of American Warfighters and Security Forces. Opportunity to work with cutting edge technology.

Extensive opportunities for continuous learning, professional growth and advancement. We only hire the best! No matter if you are entry or senior level, you will have the opportunity learn from some of the best in the industry. We have fun!

We regularly have company events, from luncheons and costume contests to golf tournaments. We care about YOU and YOUR FAMILY. We offer competitive benefits and health insurance options. No One Has Time for Long Job Applications!

Job Summary
The Los Angeles Homeless Services Authority (LAHSA) seeks motivated professionals who want to use their talents and skills to make a difference. Our staff are flexible and passionate about enriching people’s lives. If you are mission-driven, dedicated to superior service and support, can diligently work independently and in a collaborative environment, join our team. LAHSA is leading the fight to end homelessness in LA County. Here, not only would your work have a real impact on the community, but we also offer a comprehensive and competitive benefits package.
Created in 1993, LAHSA is a joint powers authority of the city and county of Los Angeles. As the lead agency in the HUD-funded Los Angeles Continuum of Care, we coordinate and manage over $300 million annually in federal, state, county, and city funds for programs providing shelter, housing, and services to people experiencing homelessness.
Under the direction of the Associate Director – Budget Unit, the Budget & Financial Planning Manager oversees both Internal and External Budget teams-and their respective Budget Analysts-to conduct long-term budgetary and financial planning related to LAHSA's internal operations and external funding sources. Internally, this position oversees the management and adjustment of LAHSA Department and Program Budgets, which use "Indirect" or "Administrative" funding. Externally, this position determines and manages how much funding received from External funding sources is "passed through" LAHSA as "Direct" or programmatic funding into various Subrecipient Contracts' Budgets, as well as how much is retained by LAHSA as "Administrative" or "Indirect" funds to operate its Departments and Programs.

Job Title: Director of Financial Planning and Analysis
Job Description:
Who Are We? QinetiQ Inc. is a leading innovator with over 25 years of experience rapidly developing advanced C5ISR sensor solutions and is a renowned world leader in robotics and autonomy. The combined QinetiQ U.S.

business unit brings capabilities across the full lifecycle of technology development from applied research and development to rapid prototyping, testing, fielding, and sustainment. Our expertise with unmanned platforms, broad sensing modalities, and cross-domain interoperability ensures that we deliver integrated solutions for Warfighter dominance in all phases of combat. We are a world-class team of professionals who deliver next generation technology and products in robotic and autonomous platforms and systems, ground systems, soldier systems, maritime systems, airborne sensors and payloads, processing and exploitation capabilities, and integrated C2 solutions. Much of our work contributes to innovative research in ﬁelds such as sensor science, signal processing, data fusion, artiﬁcial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML), and augmented reality (AR).

Our customers are always our number one priority and we consistently deliver Mission-Led Innovation to empower and protect our Defense and Security forces in the U.S. and abroad. QinetiQ Inc. C5ISR Solutions is looking for an experienced, colloborative financial professional to lead our financial planning & analysis function.

In this role the Director of Financial Planning & Analysis will contribute to our mission by doing the following: Your Contribution to Our Mission: Prepare annual profit and loss (" P& L"), indirect cost budgets, quarterly P&L forecasts and periodic indirect cost forecasts. Perform monthly reporting of actual versus budgeted performance of P&L, balance sheet and cash flow and supporting variance analysis (include in g program-level drivers). Prepare monthly indirect cost reports and variance to budget analysis for department heads and senior management. Conduct monthly reviews and quarterly executive reviews of same.

Ensure accurate monthly program-level budgeting for use by program managers and baseline input to business forecasts. Ensure appropriate revenue recognition for various contract types, including profit accrual. Prepare monthly funded and unfunded backlog reports. Provide program funding requirements to Program Offices and prepare the financial analysis required for work-at-risk request form on a timely basis.

Participate in annual strategic planning process, including development of estimating models and preparation of summary financial estimates. Prepare financial data and appropriate variance comments for presentation to the board of directors in addition to coordination/preparation of the board booklet. Scrutinize the indirect rate performance as part of monthly closing process and conduct monthly management meetings to discuss indirect cost performance versus budget. To Land This Job, You Need: 8-10+ years of work experience in financial planning & analysis, accounting, consulting, and/or corporate finance.

Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or Finance required, MBA is a plus. Exceptional financial modeling skills. Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy. Excellent analytical abilities, problem-solving skills and business acumen.

Exceptional written and verbal communications skills. Excellent project and time management abilities. Ability to work under pressure within short time constraints. Ability to effectively interact with all levels of management on financial related issues.

Strong Ability and clearly articulate financial material and analytics and provide guidance to leadership acting as a business partner. Job Type: Full Time Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain : DOD Secret Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain: DOD Secret Why QinetiQ Inc.? Your work will contribute to the protection of American Warfighters and Security Forces. Opportunity to work with cutting edge technology.

Extensive opportunities for continuous learning, professional growth and advancement. We only hire the best! No matter if you are entry or senior level, you will have the opportunity learn from some of the best in the industry. We have fun!

We regularly have company events, from luncheons and costume contests to golf tournaments. We care about YOU and YOUR FAMILY. We offer competitive benefits and health insurance options. No One Has Time for Long Job Applications!

We completely understand. That is why we have made the application process easy. We promise. This will be simple.

If because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to staffing@us.qinetiq.com or call (540) 658-2720 Opt 4 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. QinetiQ Inc. is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

The professionals at the National Security Agency (NSA) have one common goal: to protect our nation. The mission requires a strong offense and a steadfast defense. The offense collects, processes and disseminates intelligence information derived from foreign signals for intelligence and counterintelligence purposes. The defense prevents adversaries from gaining access to sensitive classified national security information. The National Security Agency employs a wide variety of business professionals who play a critical role through budgetary and contract activities that support our nation's security every day. We rely on the skills of our acquisition, finance, and accounting professionals to support the internal infrastructure of a federal agency comparable in size and budget to Fortune 100 companies. We are seeking passionate Business Management and Acquisition professionals to work as Business Financial Managers (BFM). Responsibilities of a Business Financial Manager include, but are not limited to: - Budgeting, accounting, and reporting, as well as analyzing and interpreting the financial significance of past events and future plans - Certifying availability and accountability of funds and entitlements. - Reviewing and/or approve budgets. - Training in federal acquisition and budgetary transactions to become certified in Business Financial Management under the Defense Acquisition Workforce Improvement Act (DAWIA) and the Department of Defense Financial Management (DoD-FM) certification within 24 months

The effective fiscal management and regulatory compliance of our grant programs is critical to the achievement of our mission. Our internal operating culture can best be characterized as a “quick-paced”, solutions driven environment with a passion for excellence.

This full-time position is accountable for overseeing all the foundation’s financial management activities. In addition, this position is accountable for ensuring the effective flow and execution of all office administrative and project related activities.

Who Are We? QinetiQ Inc. is a leading innovator with over 25 years of experience rapidly developing advanced C5ISR sensor solutions and is a renowned world leader in robotics and autonomy. The combined QinetiQ U.S.

business unit brings capabilities across the full lifecycle of technology development from applied research and development to rapid prototyping, testing, fielding, and sustainment. Our expertise with unmanned platforms, broad sensing modalities, and cross-domain interoperability ensures that we deliver integrated solutions for Warfighter dominance in all phases of combat. We are a world-class team of professionals who deliver next generation technology and products in robotic and autonomous platforms and systems, ground systems, soldier systems, maritime systems, airborne sensors and payloads, processing and exploitation capabilities, and integrated C2 solutions. Much of our work contributes to innovative research in ﬁelds such as sensor science, signal processing, data fusion, artiﬁcial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML), and augmented reality (AR).

Our customers are always our number one priority and we consistently deliver Mission-Led Innovation to empower and protect our Defense and Security forces in the U.S. and abroad. QinetiQ Inc. C5ISR Solutions is looking for an experienced, colloborative financial professional to lead our financial planning & analysis function.

In this role the Director of Financial Planning & Analysis will contribute to our mission by doing the following: Your Contribution to Our Mission: Prepare annual profit and loss (" P& L"), indirect cost budgets, quarterly P&L forecasts and periodic indirect cost forecasts. Perform monthly reporting of actual versus budgeted performance of P&L, balance sheet and cash flow and supporting variance analysis (include in g program-level drivers). Prepare monthly indirect cost reports and variance to budget analysis for department heads and senior management. Conduct monthly reviews and quarterly executive reviews of same.

Ensure accurate monthly program-level budgeting for use by program managers and baseline input to business forecasts. Ensure appropriate revenue recognition for various contract types, including profit accrual. Prepare monthly funded and unfunded backlog reports. Provide program funding requirements to Program Offices and prepare the financial analysis required for work-at-risk request form on a timely basis.

Participate in annual strategic planning process, including development of estimating models and preparation of summary financial estimates. Prepare financial data and appropriate variance comments for presentation to the board of directors in addition to coordination/preparation of the board booklet. Scrutinize the indirect rate performance as part of monthly closing process and conduct monthly management meetings to discuss indirect cost performance versus budget. To Land This Job, You Need: 8-10+ years of work experience in financial planning & analysis, accounting, consulting, and/or corporate finance.

Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or Finance required, MBA is a plus. Exceptional financial modeling skills. Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy. Excellent analytical abilities, problem-solving skills and business acumen.

Exceptional written and verbal communications skills. Excellent project and time management abilities. Ability to work under pressure within short time constraints. Ability to effectively interact with all levels of management on financial related issues.

Strong Ability and clearly articulate financial material and analytics and provide guidance to leadership acting as a business partner. Job Type: Full Time Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain : DOD Secret Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain: DOD Secret Why QinetiQ Inc.? Your work will contribute to the protection of American Warfighters and Security Forces. Opportunity to work with cutting edge technology.

Extensive opportunities for continuous learning, professional growth and advancement. We only hire the best! No matter if you are entry or senior level, you will have the opportunity learn from some of the best in the industry. We have fun!

We regularly have company events, from luncheons and costume contests to golf tournaments. We care about YOU and YOUR FAMILY. We offer competitive benefits and health insurance options. No One Has Time for Long Job Applications!

We completely understand. That is why we have made the application process easy. We promise. This will be simple.

If because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to staffing@us.qinetiq.com or call (540) 658-2720 Opt 4 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. QinetiQ Inc. is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

Financial Planning and Analysis Director leads the budgeting, forecasting, long-term planning, implementation, and business strategic analysis of the financial team.
Conducts financial analysis, modeling, forecasting and reporting efforts to ensure efficient financial operations.
Being a Financial Planning and Analysis Director reviews analysis results, develops insightful suggestions for investment, sourcing, cost reduction and leads strategic business decisions.
Requires a bachelor's degree.
Additionally, Financial Planning and Analysis Director typically reports to top management or CFO.

WHY TAKE THE ROLE:
Opportunity for career growth- move into a business unit or climb the ladder in corporate. Role is open due to promotion
Company is growing, organically and through acquisitions
Very well-respected, global, private company

iolo / RealDefense is seeking a Manager of FP&A to spearhead and grow our finance team in accordance with corporate goals. The Manager of FP&A will be responsible for contributing management level finance expertise. This includes providing financial forecasts, annual budgets, operating plans, variance analyses, cash flow modelling, and special projects such as M&A valuations, KPI analyses, cohort analyses, and inventory purchasing projections.

The Senior Manager supporting the Dunkin’ Advertising Fund will empower data-driven strategic decision making by creating, budgeting/forecasting, analyzing, reporting and communicating financial information into actionable insights for Finance & Marketing Leadership. In this position, the Senior Manager provides overall financial management leadership to the Dunkin’ U.S. marketing team by overseeing the financial modeling and analyses to track, forecast and report sales/revenue and Ad Spend, ultimately ensuring accurate reporting to Dunkin’ Leadership and franchisees; own processes, work independently and contribute to overall team success; support various groups within the organization including, but not limited to: Brand Marketing, Integrated/Field Marketing, Marketing Strategy, Digital Marketing, Franchisees, various Corporate Services segments and Finance. This Dunkin’ U.S. Senior Finance Manager role will also support other aspects of the Dunkin’ U.S. business in conjunction with, and in support of, the Finance Director - Dunkin’ U.S. as we continue to evolve and adapt to new business normal requirements and expectations of the COVID-19 environment. This role requires a professional and experienced Finance manager who displays the ability to adapt and improvise to the “needs at hand” to support all aspect of the business with sound financial acumen and management skills.

Job Title: Director Of Financial Planning And Analysis
Job Description:
Are you a driven finance executive looking for a new opportunity? Well, this position could be for you! We are conducting a search for a Director of Financial Planning and Analysis to join a top performing multi-site healthcare company in Tampa Bay!
Director of Financial Planning and Analysis Benefits and Compensation:
A professional, fast-paced, working environment
GREAT leadership and high visibility
Strong benefits, including 401(k)
Highly competitive compensation of $115,000 - $130,000 (commensurate with experience), plus bonus potential!
Director of Financial Planning and Analysis Job Duties:

Job Description
Are you an experienced Finance Manager looking for a new opportunity? Then come learn about our opening as a Senior Finance Manager. You will be supporting the Financial Planning & Analysis department with a primary focus of managing the Corporate General and Administrative Financial Operations segment.
What will I be doing:
The Finance Manager will lead the monthly, quarterly and annual processes and deliverables including, but not limited to, Operating forecasts, headcount tracking, management reporting, monthly and quarterly business reviews, statistical analysis, forecast reconciliations, allocations, Board presentations, investor relations support and American Resort Development Association (ARDA) surveys. You will provide ad-hoc expense analysis to support Business Units or any corporate initiatives while leading the consolidated review on expense execution against Budget/Forecast. The role will also play a key role in managing operating expense risk. This leader will assist with the coordination and preparation of the annual operating budgets. The Senior Manager will assist the department in ad-hoc analysis, advanced modeling, and other FP&A functions as needed. Secondary responsibilities will include maintaining and enhancing the company headcount management and tracking process.

Casetext is a fast-growing legal technology company tackling the $6 billion U.S. legal research market and advancing the cause of justice by empowering all attorneys to provide high-quality, efficient, and affordable representation to their clients. Our award winning research platform helps millions of users access and understand the law every month, and our AI-powered search tools are at the cutting edge of search technology. Casetext is backed by Union Square Ventures, Canvas Ventures, 8VC, Y Combinator and Touchdown Ventures.
Casetext is seeking a Vice President of Finance to drive financial and strategic leadership across our business. You will lead all core finance activities, building operational excellence into how we approach accounting, reporting, financial operations, and financial planning. As a member of our executive team and in partnership with the board, you will inform how we strategically budget for growth as we scale our business and launch new product offerings. You will be responsible for managing the company’s cash flow, maintaining compliance with tax and audit requirements, and ensuring that our revenues, vendor bills, and other company expenses are properly invoiced, collected, and reported. This role reports to Casetext’s co-founder and COO.

Job Description
Company Overview:
We are a privately held, established and reputable company that has been in business since 1979. We excel in multiple markets in various packaging industries. We have business plants in Brea CA and Portland TN. Our Corporate office is located in Brea CA.
Position:
The VP of Finance will report directly to the President/CEO. The VP of Finance is responsible for company-wide financial operations, contract administration and capital planning. The VP of Finance will be responsible for the finance/accounting department and share oversight of (HR) Human Resources, Legal Issues, Insurance Issues and Merger & Acquisition support/Potential New Investments. The successful candidate should have excellent interpersonal skills, high level financial and professional business acumen.

The Director of Financial Planning & Analysis will provide overall leadership and management for all company financial forecasts, budgets, and financial planning activities. This role will be responsible for delivering value-added analysis and meaningful financial and operating metrics that lead to insightful, accurate business decision-making. The successful candidate must be a hands-on and results oriented leader, who will have responsibility for developing P&L and KPI management reporting requirements. This position will be the bridge between corporate and Business Area financial data integration and will develop and report against established financial metrics on a monthly, quarterly, and annual basis. Additional responsibility will include; management and oversight of timely and accurate financial planning, analysis and reporting to support the company objectives, while ensuring industry and government financial compliance, and M&A financial due diligence.

We are looking to hire a top-notch finance pro for our Manager, Financial Planning & Analysis opening. This is a newly created role that will have the exciting opportunity to lead the corporate FP&A function. We are adding additional resources to a growing FP&A team and you will be a key member of that process. Not only will you be focused on short-term and long term financial planning of the business but you will also get to support and work with business leaders across the organization. Responsibilities:
Partner with members throughout the organization to improve forecasting processes
Design new and update existing financial models
Lead aspects of the annual operating plan and periodic reforecasting process

Founded in 2000, First Pacific Funding is and always will be a devoted and dedicated Vendor-driven Funding source based out of the Pacific Northwest.
First Pacific Funding has the privilege of dealing with seasoned Leasing Representatives working out of offices & home offices spread all throughout the U.S.
From the beginning, our core values were to find the most successful, accredited salespeople in the leasing industry, and provide them with up to date technology to keep them and their customers up to speed in real-time on the status of their transactions.
FPF thrives on being on the leading edge of technology with our vendors and providing the necessary tools to give them the advantage over their competition. FPF's online product streamlines the vendor’s life with easy access to all of their customer’s applications and status with the click of a button.

We are a leading independent global asset manager, dedicated to delivering the best outcomes for our clients through a highly diversified range of actively-managed products. We are truly global, supporting our individual and institutional investors across a range of products, encompassing equities, fixed income, multi-asset and alternatives. Our high-energy and collaborative culture at Janus Henderson helps our client achieve their goals and ensures that our people love the place they work.

Distribution is responsible for the marketing, promotion and ongoing development of our product offering, for both institutional and intermediary channels globally. Distribution is a trusted partner to our clients and we enable investment solutions through active management. Areas within Distribution consist of Sales, Global Marketing, Global Product and Investment Trusts.

Responsibilities
Working closely with the executive team and Partnering Regional Operators (PRO’s) to formulate the business's medium to long term financial and strategic plan.

Analyze performance relative to budget and prior year for each
Work with PRO’s to build their annual budgets and forecasts.
Producing models to project long term growth and determine the impacting business factors.

RailWorks is the leading railroad contractor in North America. We are seeking a Manager, Financial Reporting to join our team. This position can sit remotely.
The Manager, Financial Reporting leads financial reporting and analysis efforts. Performs internal and external reporting duties and advises on technical accounting and policy issues.

Job Title: Manager of Finance and Administration (Hybrid in NYC)
Job Description:
PNP is proud to partner with The Foundation for Child Development in their search for a Manager of Finance and Administration.
ABOUT THE FOUNDATION: Our mission is to harness the power of research to ensure that all children benefit from early learning experiences that affirm their individual, family, and community assets, fortify them against harmful consequences arising from economic instability and social exclusion, and that strengthen their developmental potential. The effective fiscal management and regulatory compliance of our grant programs is critical to the achievement of our mission. Our internal operating culture can best be characterized as a “quick-paced”, solutions driven environment with a passion for excellence.
POSITION SUMMARY: The Manager of Finance and Administration is a key position that reports to the President and Chief Executive Officer of the Foundation. This full-time position is accountable for overseeing all the foundation’s financial management activities. This includes ensuring effective financial policies, compliance with grant regulations, appropriate accounting controls, and monitoring all budgetary expenditures. In addition, this position is accountable for ensuring the effective flow and execution of all office administrative and project related activities.

Our client specializes in the management, optimization and development of power generation in the United States and Canada and is a portfolio company of the private equity firm The Blackstone Group L.P. (“Blackstone”). Blackstone is a leading global alternative asset manager with $538 billion of total assets under management. Currently, they manages approximately 6.9 GW of generation in Texas, Ohio, and Indiana.
We are currently recruiting for the role of Finance Manager. The position will report directly to the Director of Reporting and will have frequent exposure to management. This position requires minimal travel within the domestic US. Eligible candidates must be vaccinated against COVID.
Position Overview:
The Finance Manager will be responsible for the annual budgeting process; monthly financial and operational management reporting packages; budget variance analysis; performing financial analysis for decision support of investments; performing financial analysis of the medium and long-term financial performance of the business; and supporting the larger Finance organization as needed.

The Manager of Financial Reporting is responsible for preparation, review and analysis of consolidated financial statements in accordance with GAAP and SEC rules and regulations, including the drafting and filing of Forms 10-K, 10-Q and 8-K; identification, evaluation and documentation of technical accounting matters including implementation of new accounting pronouncements; oversee the initial accounting for acquisitions including the review of third party valuations, preparation and review of internal financial reports and analyses provided to executive management.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Independently responsible for all external financial reporting, including preparing and filing quarterly and annual regulatory filings and other required filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission, including review and approval of iXBRL reporting

Xero is a beautiful, easy-to-use platform that helps small businesses and their accounting and bookkeeping advisors grow and thrive.

At Xero, our purpose is to make life better for people in small business, their advisors, and communities around the world. This purpose sits at the centre of everything we do. We support our people to do the best work of their lives so that they can help small businesses succeed through better tools, information and connections. Because when they succeed they make a difference, and when millions of small businesses are making a difference, the world is a more beautiful place.

As the Country Finance Manager for the US, you will oversee all aspects of the finance function within the country with a focus on optimizing business results. You will sit on the country GTM exec team (mostly Director level) and contribute as a peer leader, and not just as a finance professional. We are seeking a remarkable individual to leverage their strong financial, analytical and communication skills to become the go-to expert on all things finance for the United States. You will be the key owner of the planning, forecasting, analysis and internal reporting of the country’s financial performance. You will help ensure resources are effectively aligned to drive exceptional performance, provide a clear view and understanding of results and produce insights into likely future performance. You will use your robust financial skills along with your highly honed communication style to effectively support senior leaders and help drive optimized economic results.

The ideal candidate for the Finance Manager position will have an outgoing personality and positive attitude, along with the expertise of building strong relationships with customers. The Finance Manager is required to review each customer’s credit application, present financing options, and prepare the delivery documentation.
We Provide:
Comprehensive training by auto specialists
Daily interaction with people
Mentoring from professionals with a proven track record
No Prospecting required

Reporting to the CFO, the Director of Finance has the opportunity to join our company, at an exciting time of high growth for the company.
The role is highly visible and partners with leadership at all levels.
The Director of Finance will be responsible for forecasting, budgeting, financials, and scenario planning through the development of decision frameworks and the use of accepted methodologies.
Candidates will have experience evaluating business economics for recommendation and a track record of well-informed judgment around technical and business investment opportunities. The Director of Finance will support the management and execution of finance-focused process improvement projects.

CentralReach is a leading provider of end-to-end EMR, practice management and clinical solutions that enable applied behavior analysis (ABA) clinicians and educators to produce superior outcomes for people with autism. The company is revolutionizing the ABA space with cutting-edge solutions including precision teaching, clinical data collection, scheduling, billing, learning management, fully digital evidence-based programming and more. Trusted by more than 100,000 clinicians and educators, CentralReach is committed to ongoing product improvement, market-leading industry expertise, world-class client satisfaction, and support of the ABA community to propel industry practitioners into a new era of excellence.

The Director of Financial Planning and Analysis is a team lead position with responsibility for all financial analysis, budgeting and forecasting activities (including internal, Board and lender reporting), managing the collation and presentation of operating data and analytics, and strategic decision support. To succeed in this role, the person must have attention to detail, and an analytical, operationally-oriented professional who is able to aggregate, disaggregate, analyze and interpret financial data to convey business results.

In the spirit of collaboration, excellence, and innovation, we at Linc housing are committed to building and preserving housing that is affordable, environmentally sustainable and a catalyst for community improvement. Our team works hard to address California’s homelessness crisis by building supportive housing and addressing the affordable housing needs of California’s diverse population.
We are proud of and inspired by our mission to build communities and strengthen neighborhoods for people underserved by the marketplace. Our feats could not have been achieved without the resilience and drive for excellence put forth by our team. If you are interested in joining a team of dedicated, caring, and talented individuals inspired to make change, you have found the right place.

Job Title: Director of Financial Planning and Analysis
Job Description:
Who Are We? QinetiQ Inc. is a leading innovator with over 25 years of experience rapidly developing advanced C5ISR sensor solutions and is a renowned world leader in robotics and autonomy. The combined QinetiQ U.S.

business unit brings capabilities across the full lifecycle of technology development from applied research and development to rapid prototyping, testing, fielding, and sustainment. Our expertise with unmanned platforms, broad sensing modalities, and cross-domain interoperability ensures that we deliver integrated solutions for Warfighter dominance in all phases of combat. We are a world-class team of professionals who deliver next generation technology and products in robotic and autonomous platforms and systems, ground systems, soldier systems, maritime systems, airborne sensors and payloads, processing and exploitation capabilities, and integrated C2 solutions. Much of our work contributes to innovative research in ﬁelds such as sensor science, signal processing, data fusion, artiﬁcial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML), and augmented reality (AR).

Our customers are always our number one priority and we consistently deliver Mission-Led Innovation to empower and protect our Defense and Security forces in the U.S. and abroad. QinetiQ Inc. C5ISR Solutions is looking for an experienced, colloborative financial professional to lead our financial planning & analysis function.

In this role the Director of Financial Planning & Analysis will contribute to our mission by doing the following: Your Contribution to Our Mission: Prepare annual profit and loss (" P& L"), indirect cost budgets, quarterly P&L forecasts and periodic indirect cost forecasts. Perform monthly reporting of actual versus budgeted performance of P&L, balance sheet and cash flow and supporting variance analysis (include in g program-level drivers). Prepare monthly indirect cost reports and variance to budget analysis for department heads and senior management. Conduct monthly reviews and quarterly executive reviews of same.

Ensure accurate monthly program-level budgeting for use by program managers and baseline input to business forecasts. Ensure appropriate revenue recognition for various contract types, including profit accrual. Prepare monthly funded and unfunded backlog reports. Provide program funding requirements to Program Offices and prepare the financial analysis required for work-at-risk request form on a timely basis.

Participate in annual strategic planning process, including development of estimating models and preparation of summary financial estimates. Prepare financial data and appropriate variance comments for presentation to the board of directors in addition to coordination/preparation of the board booklet. Scrutinize the indirect rate performance as part of monthly closing process and conduct monthly management meetings to discuss indirect cost performance versus budget. To Land This Job, You Need: 8-10+ years of work experience in financial planning & analysis, accounting, consulting, and/or corporate finance.

Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or Finance required, MBA is a plus. Exceptional financial modeling skills. Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy. Excellent analytical abilities, problem-solving skills and business acumen.

Exceptional written and verbal communications skills. Excellent project and time management abilities. Ability to work under pressure within short time constraints. Ability to effectively interact with all levels of management on financial related issues.

Strong Ability and clearly articulate financial material and analytics and provide guidance to leadership acting as a business partner. Job Type: Full Time Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain : DOD Secret Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain: DOD Secret Why QinetiQ Inc.? Your work will contribute to the protection of American Warfighters and Security Forces. Opportunity to work with cutting edge technology.

We regularly have company events, from luncheons and costume contests to golf tournaments. We care about YOU and YOUR FAMILY. We offer competitive benefits and health insurance options. No One Has Time for Long Job Applications!

Job Title: Director Of Financial Planning And Analysis
Job Description:
Are you a driven finance executive looking for a new opportunity? Well, this position could be for you! We are conducting a search for a Director of Financial Planning and Analysis to join a top performing multi-site healthcare company in Tampa Bay!
Director of Financial Planning and Analysis Benefits and Compensation:
A professional, fast-paced, working environment
GREAT leadership and high visibility
Strong benefits, including 401(k)
Highly competitive compensation of $115,000 - $130,000 (commensurate with experience), plus bonus potential!
Director of Financial Planning and Analysis Job Duties:

Casetext is a fast-growing legal technology company tackling the $6 billion U.S. legal research market and advancing the cause of justice by empowering all attorneys to provide high-quality, efficient, and affordable representation to their clients. Our award winning research platform helps millions of users access and understand the law every month, and our AI-powered search tools are at the cutting edge of search technology. Casetext is backed by Union Square Ventures, Canvas Ventures, 8VC, Y Combinator and Touchdown Ventures.
Casetext is seeking a Vice President of Finance to drive financial and strategic leadership across our business. You will lead all core finance activities, building operational excellence into how we approach accounting, reporting, financial operations, and financial planning. As a member of our executive team and in partnership with the board, you will inform how we strategically budget for growth as we scale our business and launch new product offerings. You will be responsible for managing the company’s cash flow, maintaining compliance with tax and audit requirements, and ensuring that our revenues, vendor bills, and other company expenses are properly invoiced, collected, and reported. This role reports to Casetext’s co-founder and COO.

Medisolv is seeking a Manager of Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A). Reporting to the Chief Financial Officer, this position will provide enterprise-wide leadership of the budgeting, forecasting, long-term planning, implementation, and strategic business analysis function. They will lead financial analysis, modeling, forecasting, pricing analysis, and financial reporting to ensure efficient business operations. Further, they will review outcomes with an analytical mindset, develop thoughtful recommendations for strategic initiatives and provide cost management recommendations for business units.
Essential Functions:
Manage and develop strategic planning, performance metrics, management reporting, annual budgets, interim forecasts and financial analyses for the company
Conduct sensitivity analysis around broad and in-depth internal and external factors
Partner with executive management to enable informed decision making based on trends, analysis and “what-if” outcomes

Job Description
Are you an experienced Finance Manager looking for a new opportunity? Then come learn about our opening as a Senior Finance Manager. You will be supporting the Financial Planning & Analysis department with a primary focus of managing the Corporate General and Administrative Financial Operations segment.
What will I be doing:
The Finance Manager will lead the monthly, quarterly and annual processes and deliverables including, but not limited to, Operating forecasts, headcount tracking, management reporting, monthly and quarterly business reviews, statistical analysis, forecast reconciliations, allocations, Board presentations, investor relations support and American Resort Development Association (ARDA) surveys. You will provide ad-hoc expense analysis to support Business Units or any corporate initiatives while leading the consolidated review on expense execution against Budget/Forecast. The role will also play a key role in managing operating expense risk. This leader will assist with the coordination and preparation of the annual operating budgets. The Senior Manager will assist the department in ad-hoc analysis, advanced modeling, and other FP&A functions as needed. Secondary responsibilities will include maintaining and enhancing the company headcount management and tracking process.

The VP of Finance will be responsible for the finance/accounting department and share oversight of (HR) Human Resources, Legal Issues, Insurance Issues and Merger & Acquisition support/Potential New Investments. The successful candidate should have excellent interpersonal skills, high level financial and professional business acumen.

Job Title: Director of Financial Planning and Analysis
Job Description:
Who Are We? QinetiQ Inc. is a leading innovator with over 25 years of experience rapidly developing advanced C5ISR sensor solutions and is a renowned world leader in robotics and autonomy. The combined QinetiQ U.S.

business unit brings capabilities across the full lifecycle of technology development from applied research and development to rapid prototyping, testing, fielding, and sustainment. Our expertise with unmanned platforms, broad sensing modalities, and cross-domain interoperability ensures that we deliver integrated solutions for Warfighter dominance in all phases of combat. We are a world-class team of professionals who deliver next generation technology and products in robotic and autonomous platforms and systems, ground systems, soldier systems, maritime systems, airborne sensors and payloads, processing and exploitation capabilities, and integrated C2 solutions. Much of our work contributes to innovative research in ﬁelds such as sensor science, signal processing, data fusion, artiﬁcial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML), and augmented reality (AR).

Our customers are always our number one priority and we consistently deliver Mission-Led Innovation to empower and protect our Defense and Security forces in the U.S. and abroad. QinetiQ Inc. C5ISR Solutions is looking for an experienced, colloborative financial professional to lead our financial planning & analysis function.

In this role the Director of Financial Planning & Analysis will contribute to our mission by doing the following: Your Contribution to Our Mission: Prepare annual profit and loss (" P& L"), indirect cost budgets, quarterly P&L forecasts and periodic indirect cost forecasts. Perform monthly reporting of actual versus budgeted performance of P&L, balance sheet and cash flow and supporting variance analysis (include in g program-level drivers). Prepare monthly indirect cost reports and variance to budget analysis for department heads and senior management. Conduct monthly reviews and quarterly executive reviews of same.

Ensure accurate monthly program-level budgeting for use by program managers and baseline input to business forecasts. Ensure appropriate revenue recognition for various contract types, including profit accrual. Prepare monthly funded and unfunded backlog reports. Provide program funding requirements to Program Offices and prepare the financial analysis required for work-at-risk request form on a timely basis.

Participate in annual strategic planning process, including development of estimating models and preparation of summary financial estimates. Prepare financial data and appropriate variance comments for presentation to the board of directors in addition to coordination/preparation of the board booklet. Scrutinize the indirect rate performance as part of monthly closing process and conduct monthly management meetings to discuss indirect cost performance versus budget. To Land This Job, You Need: 8-10+ years of work experience in financial planning & analysis, accounting, consulting, and/or corporate finance.

Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or Finance required, MBA is a plus. Exceptional financial modeling skills. Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy. Excellent analytical abilities, problem-solving skills and business acumen.

Exceptional written and verbal communications skills. Excellent project and time management abilities. Ability to work under pressure within short time constraints. Ability to effectively interact with all levels of management on financial related issues.

Strong Ability and clearly articulate financial material and analytics and provide guidance to leadership acting as a business partner. Job Type: Full Time Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain : DOD Secret Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain: DOD Secret Why QinetiQ Inc.? Your work will contribute to the protection of American Warfighters and Security Forces. Opportunity to work with cutting edge technology.

Extensive opportunities for continuous learning, professional growth and advancement. We only hire the best! No matter if you are entry or senior level, you will have the opportunity learn from some of the best in the industry. We have fun!

We regularly have company events, from luncheons and costume contests to golf tournaments. We care about YOU and YOUR FAMILY. We offer competitive benefits and health insurance options. No One Has Time for Long Job Applications!

Job Description
Are you an experienced Finance Manager looking for a new opportunity? Then come learn about our opening as a Senior Finance Manager. You will be supporting the Financial Planning & Analysis department with a primary focus of managing the Corporate General and Administrative Financial Operations segment.
What will I be doing:
The Finance Manager will lead the monthly, quarterly and annual processes and deliverables including, but not limited to, Operating forecasts, headcount tracking, management reporting, monthly and quarterly business reviews, statistical analysis, forecast reconciliations, allocations, Board presentations, investor relations support and American Resort Development Association (ARDA) surveys. You will provide ad-hoc expense analysis to support Business Units or any corporate initiatives while leading the consolidated review on expense execution against Budget/Forecast. The role will also play a key role in managing operating expense risk. This leader will assist with the coordination and preparation of the annual operating budgets. The Senior Manager will assist the department in ad-hoc analysis, advanced modeling, and other FP&A functions as needed. Secondary responsibilities will include maintaining and enhancing the company headcount management and tracking process.

Medisolv is seeking a Manager of Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A). Reporting to the Chief Financial Officer, this position will provide enterprise-wide leadership of the budgeting, forecasting, long-term planning, implementation, and strategic business analysis function. They will lead financial analysis, modeling, forecasting, pricing analysis, and financial reporting to ensure efficient business operations. Further, they will review outcomes with an analytical mindset, develop thoughtful recommendations for strategic initiatives and provide cost management recommendations for business units.
Essential Functions:
Manage and develop strategic planning, performance metrics, management reporting, annual budgets, interim forecasts and financial analyses for the company
Conduct sensitivity analysis around broad and in-depth internal and external factors
Partner with executive management to enable informed decision making based on trends, analysis and “what-if” outcomes

Casetext is a fast-growing legal technology company tackling the $6 billion U.S. legal research market and advancing the cause of justice by empowering all attorneys to provide high-quality, efficient, and affordable representation to their clients. Our award winning research platform helps millions of users access and understand the law every month, and our AI-powered search tools are at the cutting edge of search technology. Casetext is backed by Union Square Ventures, Canvas Ventures, 8VC, Y Combinator and Touchdown Ventures.
Casetext is seeking a Vice President of Finance to drive financial and strategic leadership across our business. You will lead all core finance activities, building operational excellence into how we approach accounting, reporting, financial operations, and financial planning. As a member of our executive team and in partnership with the board, you will inform how we strategically budget for growth as we scale our business and launch new product offerings. You will be responsible for managing the company’s cash flow, maintaining compliance with tax and audit requirements, and ensuring that our revenues, vendor bills, and other company expenses are properly invoiced, collected, and reported. This role reports to Casetext’s co-founder and COO.

Job Description
Operating within the Corporate Finance function, the Senior Manager, FP&A is a key member of Vertex's Financial Planning & Analysis team, providing financial direction and strategic insight including identification of key value drivers and Business KPIs, helping the organization deliver on long-term goals and influencing strategy. This role will help drive our annual long-range planning process and will partner closely with functional teams to consolidate and analyze enterprise portfolio financial metrics (profitability, valuations, scenarios, etc.), with a focus on influencing business strategy and decisions through an understanding of the key drivers of long-term performance, enterprise value and communicating the range of possible outcomes. The best candidate will also endeavor to identify process improvement opportunities and will collaborate with functional teams to ensure standardization where appropriate.

Job Title: S& Financial Services Corp Strategy Manager
Job Description:
A career within Corporate and Business Strategy services, will provide you with the opportunity to help our clients solve their toughest problems and seize essential advantages by defining and evaluating strategies of all types. We analyse business and market trends to explore new approaches that help our clients make tough choices and surpass the competition. At both the business unit and corporate level, we help organisations with organic enterprise growth, pricing and profitability, shareholder value, and sustainable corporate strategies.

To really stand out and make us fit for the future in a constantly changing world, each and every one of us at PwC needs to be a purpose-led and values-driven leader at every level. To help us achieve this we have the PwC Professional; our global leadership development framework. It gives us a single set of expectations across our lines, geographies and career paths, and provides transparency on the skills we need as individuals to be successful and progress in our careers, now and in the future.

As a Manager, you'll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this management level include but are not limited to:

Develop new skills outside of comfort zone.
Act to resolve issues which prevent the team working effectively.
Coach others, recognise their strengths, and encourage them to take ownership of their personal development.
Analyse complex ideas or proposals and build a range of meaningful recommendations.
Use multiple sources of information including broader stakeholder views to develop solutions and recommendations.
Address sub-standard work or work that does not meet firm's/client's expectations.
Use data and insights to inform conclusions and support decision-making.
Develop a point of view on key global trends, and how they impact clients.
Manage a variety of viewpoints to build consensus and create positive outcomes for all parties.
Simplify complex messages, highlighting and summarising key points.
Uphold the firm's code of ethics and business conduct.



Bachelor Degree


5 year(s)



Master of Business Administration


Minimum of 7 years of strategy consulting or industry consulting experience preferred

Demonstrates intimate knowledge and/or a proven record of success in the Financial Services industry (Banking & Capital Markets, Asset & Wealth Management), either in professional consulting services or corporate roles, including:

Demonstrates extensive knowledge of and/or success in professional services or corporate roles, helping companies define and evaluate corporate and business unit strategies and investment portfolios, reflecting market, competitive and other external drivers. Specific areas of focus include Corporate Strategy, Business Strategy, Deals Strategy, Digital Strategy, and Not for Profit Strategy.

Demonstrates extensive leadership, strategic and creative thinking, problem solving, individual initiative, and the following abilities:

Building productive and collaborative relationships with team members and proactively providing and seeking guidance, clarification, and feedback;

Managing a team to a successful project conclusion through problem solving global, enterprise-wide strategy issues;

building, maintaining, and utilizing networks of client relationships;

Communicating effectively in an organized and knowledgeable manner in written and verbal formats; and,

Conducting and managing market research and quantitative and qualitative analyses, including the timely synthesis of complex data into meaningful insights, and the ability to readily grasp analytical frameworks and employ them effectively to either qualitative or quantitative evidence.

PwC does not intend to hire experienced or entry level job seekers who will need, now or in the future, PwC sponsorship through the H-1B lottery, except as set forth within the following policy: https://pwc.to/H-1B-Lottery-Policy

At Sims Lifecycle Services, we believe progress is driven by our people. If you are set on making real change for tomorrow, we have the scale, resources, and ambition to make it happen now.
Now’s an extraordinary time to work with us. SLS is the global leader in circular cloud solutions. We will continue to drive circular economy initiatives with our clients to improve environmental outcomes and business results.
We’re looking for a highly motivated Finance Leader to work closely with the SLS Executive Team on growth and business improvement initiatives. Reporting to the SLS CFO the Manager Financial Planning & Analysis will be responsible for leading the US financial planning and analysis team by providing actionable insights and recommendations across the entire SLS business.

CGH Technologies, Inc. (CGH) is a business solutions firm, specializing in Data Management, Software Engineering, and Business Intelligence solutions. Located within the Washington corridor, CGH has worked successfully with Government, Commercial and International sectors, providing management, development and maintenance, and support of large and complex environments. CGH has an exciting opportunity for a seasoned Finance Manager to join the team.
The Finance Manager is responsible for managing the financial health of the organization, in order to promote success and growth while maintaining legal financial practices. Duties include financial planning to determine how to pay off liabilities and grow the business, reviewing financial documents to ensure tax compliance, and collaboration with other departments to achieve monetary goals.
The successful candidate will have a deep understanding of Government Contracting. And will be able to suggest strategies and advise on compliance within the government contracting sector, FAA knowledge is a plus.

WHAT YOU'LL DO

The Northeast System is the largest system globally for BCG, consisting of six offices within the North America region: Boston, New York, New Jersey, Philadelphia, Pittsburgh, Washington DC. This role also includes our US federal government practice (Fed).

As a senior member of the Northeast system finance team, the FPA manager provides support to system leadership, office leadership, system partners, consulting and business services team. They will interact regularly with Managing Directors and Partners (MDPs) and other members of senior consulting staff.

In addition, you will be connected throughout BCG matrix informing internal functions about outlook and provide decision support to help make informed decisions. This includes building and managing a team of analyst that is fostering relationships across local offices, shared services, regional functions, SBU’s and global services, driving discussions, anticipating needs, providing insight, fielding adhoc analysis and data requests.

You will also be involved with many finance initiatives, including the multi year Future of Finance, being a thought partner with stakeholders, supporting communication and change management of tools, reporting, metrics and processes. Other finance initiatives also include multiyear planning and various P&L scenario modelling.






Members of our finance team are responsible for preserving the intellectual capital, assets, and integrity of BCG. We make a decisive impact on the firm’s direction, performance, and risk-management models. Finance jobs include accounting and reporting, planning and analysis, tax and treasury, financial systems, payroll, and executive compensation.

Job Title: Director of Financial Planning and Analysis
Job Description:
Who Are We? QinetiQ Inc. is a leading innovator with over 25 years of experience rapidly developing advanced C5ISR sensor solutions and is a renowned world leader in robotics and autonomy. The combined QinetiQ U.S.

business unit brings capabilities across the full lifecycle of technology development from applied research and development to rapid prototyping, testing, fielding, and sustainment. Our expertise with unmanned platforms, broad sensing modalities, and cross-domain interoperability ensures that we deliver integrated solutions for Warfighter dominance in all phases of combat. We are a world-class team of professionals who deliver next generation technology and products in robotic and autonomous platforms and systems, ground systems, soldier systems, maritime systems, airborne sensors and payloads, processing and exploitation capabilities, and integrated C2 solutions. Much of our work contributes to innovative research in ﬁelds such as sensor science, signal processing, data fusion, artiﬁcial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML), and augmented reality (AR).

Our customers are always our number one priority and we consistently deliver Mission-Led Innovation to empower and protect our Defense and Security forces in the U.S. and abroad. QinetiQ Inc. C5ISR Solutions is looking for an experienced, colloborative financial professional to lead our financial planning & analysis function.

In this role the Director of Financial Planning & Analysis will contribute to our mission by doing the following: Your Contribution to Our Mission: Prepare annual profit and loss (" P& L"), indirect cost budgets, quarterly P&L forecasts and periodic indirect cost forecasts. Perform monthly reporting of actual versus budgeted performance of P&L, balance sheet and cash flow and supporting variance analysis (include in g program-level drivers). Prepare monthly indirect cost reports and variance to budget analysis for department heads and senior management. Conduct monthly reviews and quarterly executive reviews of same.

Ensure accurate monthly program-level budgeting for use by program managers and baseline input to business forecasts. Ensure appropriate revenue recognition for various contract types, including profit accrual. Prepare monthly funded and unfunded backlog reports. Provide program funding requirements to Program Offices and prepare the financial analysis required for work-at-risk request form on a timely basis.

Participate in annual strategic planning process, including development of estimating models and preparation of summary financial estimates. Prepare financial data and appropriate variance comments for presentation to the board of directors in addition to coordination/preparation of the board booklet. Scrutinize the indirect rate performance as part of monthly closing process and conduct monthly management meetings to discuss indirect cost performance versus budget. To Land This Job, You Need: 8-10+ years of work experience in financial planning & analysis, accounting, consulting, and/or corporate finance.

Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or Finance required, MBA is a plus. Exceptional financial modeling skills. Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy. Excellent analytical abilities, problem-solving skills and business acumen.

Exceptional written and verbal communications skills. Excellent project and time management abilities. Ability to work under pressure within short time constraints. Ability to effectively interact with all levels of management on financial related issues.

Strong Ability and clearly articulate financial material and analytics and provide guidance to leadership acting as a business partner. Job Type: Full Time Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain : DOD Secret Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain: DOD Secret Why QinetiQ Inc.? Your work will contribute to the protection of American Warfighters and Security Forces. Opportunity to work with cutting edge technology.

Extensive opportunities for continuous learning, professional growth and advancement. We only hire the best! No matter if you are entry or senior level, you will have the opportunity learn from some of the best in the industry. We have fun!

We regularly have company events, from luncheons and costume contests to golf tournaments. We care about YOU and YOUR FAMILY. We offer competitive benefits and health insurance options. No One Has Time for Long Job Applications!

Job Description

Job Title: Director of Financial Planning and Analysis
Job Description:
Who Are We? QinetiQ Inc. is a leading innovator with over 25 years of experience rapidly developing advanced C5ISR sensor solutions and is a renowned world leader in robotics and autonomy. The combined QinetiQ U.S.

business unit brings capabilities across the full lifecycle of technology development from applied research and development to rapid prototyping, testing, fielding, and sustainment. Our expertise with unmanned platforms, broad sensing modalities, and cross-domain interoperability ensures that we deliver integrated solutions for Warfighter dominance in all phases of combat. We are a world-class team of professionals who deliver next generation technology and products in robotic and autonomous platforms and systems, ground systems, soldier systems, maritime systems, airborne sensors and payloads, processing and exploitation capabilities, and integrated C2 solutions. Much of our work contributes to innovative research in ﬁelds such as sensor science, signal processing, data fusion, artiﬁcial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML), and augmented reality (AR).

Our customers are always our number one priority and we consistently deliver Mission-Led Innovation to empower and protect our Defense and Security forces in the U.S. and abroad. QinetiQ Inc. C5ISR Solutions is looking for an experienced, colloborative financial professional to lead our financial planning & analysis function.

In this role the Director of Financial Planning & Analysis will contribute to our mission by doing the following: Your Contribution to Our Mission: Prepare annual profit and loss (" P& L"), indirect cost budgets, quarterly P&L forecasts and periodic indirect cost forecasts. Perform monthly reporting of actual versus budgeted performance of P&L, balance sheet and cash flow and supporting variance analysis (include in g program-level drivers). Prepare monthly indirect cost reports and variance to budget analysis for department heads and senior management. Conduct monthly reviews and quarterly executive reviews of same.

Ensure accurate monthly program-level budgeting for use by program managers and baseline input to business forecasts. Ensure appropriate revenue recognition for various contract types, including profit accrual. Prepare monthly funded and unfunded backlog reports. Provide program funding requirements to Program Offices and prepare the financial analysis required for work-at-risk request form on a timely basis.

Participate in annual strategic planning process, including development of estimating models and preparation of summary financial estimates. Prepare financial data and appropriate variance comments for presentation to the board of directors in addition to coordination/preparation of the board booklet. Scrutinize the indirect rate performance as part of monthly closing process and conduct monthly management meetings to discuss indirect cost performance versus budget. To Land This Job, You Need: 8-10+ years of work experience in financial planning & analysis, accounting, consulting, and/or corporate finance.

Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or Finance required, MBA is a plus. Exceptional financial modeling skills. Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy. Excellent analytical abilities, problem-solving skills and business acumen.

Exceptional written and verbal communications skills. Excellent project and time management abilities. Ability to work under pressure within short time constraints. Ability to effectively interact with all levels of management on financial related issues.

Strong Ability and clearly articulate financial material and analytics and provide guidance to leadership acting as a business partner. Job Type: Full Time Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain : DOD Secret Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain: DOD Secret Why QinetiQ Inc.? Your work will contribute to the protection of American Warfighters and Security Forces. Opportunity to work with cutting edge technology.

Extensive opportunities for continuous learning, professional growth and advancement. We only hire the best! No matter if you are entry or senior level, you will have the opportunity learn from some of the best in the industry. We have fun!

We regularly have company events, from luncheons and costume contests to golf tournaments. We care about YOU and YOUR FAMILY. We offer competitive benefits and health insurance options. No One Has Time for Long Job Applications!

We completely understand. That is why we have made the application process easy. We promise. This will be simple.

If because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to staffing@us.qinetiq.com or call (540) 658-2720 Opt 4 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. QinetiQ Inc. is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.
