Job Title: Director of Financial Planning and Analysis
Job Description:
Who Are We? QinetiQ Inc. is a leading innovator with over 25 years of experience rapidly developing advanced C5ISR sensor solutions and is a renowned world leader in robotics and autonomy. The combined QinetiQ U.S.

business unit brings capabilities across the full lifecycle of technology development from applied research and development to rapid prototyping, testing, fielding, and sustainment. Our expertise with unmanned platforms, broad sensing modalities, and cross-domain interoperability ensures that we deliver integrated solutions for Warfighter dominance in all phases of combat. We are a world-class team of professionals who deliver next generation technology and products in robotic and autonomous platforms and systems, ground systems, soldier systems, maritime systems, airborne sensors and payloads, processing and exploitation capabilities, and integrated C2 solutions. Much of our work contributes to innovative research in ﬁelds such as sensor science, signal processing, data fusion, artiﬁcial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML), and augmented reality (AR).

Our customers are always our number one priority and we consistently deliver Mission-Led Innovation to empower and protect our Defense and Security forces in the U.S. and abroad. QinetiQ Inc. C5ISR Solutions is looking for an experienced, colloborative financial professional to lead our financial planning & analysis function.

In this role the Director of Financial Planning & Analysis will contribute to our mission by doing the following: Your Contribution to Our Mission: Prepare annual profit and loss (" P& L"), indirect cost budgets, quarterly P&L forecasts and periodic indirect cost forecasts. Perform monthly reporting of actual versus budgeted performance of P&L, balance sheet and cash flow and supporting variance analysis (include in g program-level drivers). Prepare monthly indirect cost reports and variance to budget analysis for department heads and senior management. Conduct monthly reviews and quarterly executive reviews of same.

Ensure accurate monthly program-level budgeting for use by program managers and baseline input to business forecasts. Ensure appropriate revenue recognition for various contract types, including profit accrual. Prepare monthly funded and unfunded backlog reports. Provide program funding requirements to Program Offices and prepare the financial analysis required for work-at-risk request form on a timely basis.

Participate in annual strategic planning process, including development of estimating models and preparation of summary financial estimates. Prepare financial data and appropriate variance comments for presentation to the board of directors in addition to coordination/preparation of the board booklet. Scrutinize the indirect rate performance as part of monthly closing process and conduct monthly management meetings to discuss indirect cost performance versus budget. To Land This Job, You Need: 8-10+ years of work experience in financial planning & analysis, accounting, consulting, and/or corporate finance.

Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or Finance required, MBA is a plus. Exceptional financial modeling skills. Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy. Excellent analytical abilities, problem-solving skills and business acumen.

Exceptional written and verbal communications skills. Excellent project and time management abilities. Ability to work under pressure within short time constraints. Ability to effectively interact with all levels of management on financial related issues.

Strong Ability and clearly articulate financial material and analytics and provide guidance to leadership acting as a business partner. Job Type: Full Time Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain : DOD Secret Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain: DOD Secret Why QinetiQ Inc.? Your work will contribute to the protection of American Warfighters and Security Forces. Opportunity to work with cutting edge technology.

We regularly have company events, from luncheons and costume contests to golf tournaments. We care about YOU and YOUR FAMILY. We offer competitive benefits and health insurance options. No One Has Time for Long Job Applications!

Operating within the Corporate Finance function, the Senior Manager, FP&A is a key member of Vertex's Financial Planning & Analysis team, providing financial direction and strategic insight including identification of key value drivers and Business KPIs, helping the organization deliver on long-term goals and influencing strategy. This role will help drive our annual long-range planning process and will partner closely with functional teams to consolidate and analyze enterprise portfolio financial metrics (profitability, valuations, scenarios, etc.), with a focus on influencing business strategy and decisions through an understanding of the key drivers of long-term performance, enterprise value and communicating the range of possible outcomes. The best candidate will also endeavor to identify process improvement opportunities and will collaborate with functional teams to ensure standardization where appropriate.

Medisolv is seeking a Manager of Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A). Reporting to the Chief Financial Officer, this position will provide enterprise-wide leadership of the budgeting, forecasting, long-term planning, implementation, and strategic business analysis function. They will lead financial analysis, modeling, forecasting, pricing analysis, and financial reporting to ensure efficient business operations. Further, they will review outcomes with an analytical mindset, develop thoughtful recommendations for strategic initiatives and provide cost management recommendations for business units.
Essential Functions:
Manage and develop strategic planning, performance metrics, management reporting, annual budgets, interim forecasts and financial analyses for the company
Conduct sensitivity analysis around broad and in-depth internal and external factors
Partner with executive management to enable informed decision making based on trends, analysis and “what-if” outcomes

Job Description
Are you an experienced Finance Manager looking for a new opportunity? Then come learn about our opening as a Senior Finance Manager. You will be supporting the Financial Planning & Analysis department with a primary focus of managing the Corporate General and Administrative Financial Operations segment.
What will I be doing:
The Finance Manager will lead the monthly, quarterly and annual processes and deliverables including, but not limited to, Operating forecasts, headcount tracking, management reporting, monthly and quarterly business reviews, statistical analysis, forecast reconciliations, allocations, Board presentations, investor relations support and American Resort Development Association (ARDA) surveys. You will provide ad-hoc expense analysis to support Business Units or any corporate initiatives while leading the consolidated review on expense execution against Budget/Forecast. The role will also play a key role in managing operating expense risk. This leader will assist with the coordination and preparation of the annual operating budgets. The Senior Manager will assist the department in ad-hoc analysis, advanced modeling, and other FP&A functions as needed. Secondary responsibilities will include maintaining and enhancing the company headcount management and tracking process.

About us
Delta Energy is a manufacturing facility in Natchez, Mississippi. We are a sustainable green chemical company with a bright future. Delta recycles end-of-life tires to make remanufactured carbon black pellets which are sold back into the tire industry to make new passenger tires. The liquid extracted is sold into the chemical market. 100% of the tire is recycled with 80% less carbon emissions than manufacturing virgin carbon black. At full production, our one plant can keep 3 million used tires from going into landfills each year.
Bridgestone Tires is not only our customer. They are also our partner. Sustainability is critical for our future. We have excellent funding from partners that believe in our mission. Construction of two new plants should be started in 2022.

Job Title: Director of Financial Planning and Analysis
Job Description:
Who Are We? QinetiQ Inc. is a leading innovator with over 25 years of experience rapidly developing advanced C5ISR sensor solutions and is a renowned world leader in robotics and autonomy. The combined QinetiQ U.S.

business unit brings capabilities across the full lifecycle of technology development from applied research and development to rapid prototyping, testing, fielding, and sustainment. Our expertise with unmanned platforms, broad sensing modalities, and cross-domain interoperability ensures that we deliver integrated solutions for Warfighter dominance in all phases of combat. We are a world-class team of professionals who deliver next generation technology and products in robotic and autonomous platforms and systems, ground systems, soldier systems, maritime systems, airborne sensors and payloads, processing and exploitation capabilities, and integrated C2 solutions. Much of our work contributes to innovative research in ﬁelds such as sensor science, signal processing, data fusion, artiﬁcial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML), and augmented reality (AR).

Our customers are always our number one priority and we consistently deliver Mission-Led Innovation to empower and protect our Defense and Security forces in the U.S. and abroad. QinetiQ Inc. C5ISR Solutions is looking for an experienced, colloborative financial professional to lead our financial planning & analysis function.

In this role the Director of Financial Planning & Analysis will contribute to our mission by doing the following: Your Contribution to Our Mission: Prepare annual profit and loss (" P& L"), indirect cost budgets, quarterly P&L forecasts and periodic indirect cost forecasts. Perform monthly reporting of actual versus budgeted performance of P&L, balance sheet and cash flow and supporting variance analysis (include in g program-level drivers). Prepare monthly indirect cost reports and variance to budget analysis for department heads and senior management. Conduct monthly reviews and quarterly executive reviews of same.

Ensure accurate monthly program-level budgeting for use by program managers and baseline input to business forecasts. Ensure appropriate revenue recognition for various contract types, including profit accrual. Prepare monthly funded and unfunded backlog reports. Provide program funding requirements to Program Offices and prepare the financial analysis required for work-at-risk request form on a timely basis.

Participate in annual strategic planning process, including development of estimating models and preparation of summary financial estimates. Prepare financial data and appropriate variance comments for presentation to the board of directors in addition to coordination/preparation of the board booklet. Scrutinize the indirect rate performance as part of monthly closing process and conduct monthly management meetings to discuss indirect cost performance versus budget. To Land This Job, You Need: 8-10+ years of work experience in financial planning & analysis, accounting, consulting, and/or corporate finance.

Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or Finance required, MBA is a plus. Exceptional financial modeling skills. Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy. Excellent analytical abilities, problem-solving skills and business acumen.

Exceptional written and verbal communications skills. Excellent project and time management abilities. Ability to work under pressure within short time constraints. Ability to effectively interact with all levels of management on financial related issues.

Strong Ability and clearly articulate financial material and analytics and provide guidance to leadership acting as a business partner. Job Type: Full Time Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain : DOD Secret Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain: DOD Secret Why QinetiQ Inc.? Your work will contribute to the protection of American Warfighters and Security Forces. Opportunity to work with cutting edge technology.

Extensive opportunities for continuous learning, professional growth and advancement. We only hire the best! No matter if you are entry or senior level, you will have the opportunity learn from some of the best in the industry. We have fun!

We regularly have company events, from luncheons and costume contests to golf tournaments. We care about YOU and YOUR FAMILY. We offer competitive benefits and health insurance options. No One Has Time for Long Job Applications!

We completely understand. That is why we have made the application process easy. We promise. This will be simple.

Your Opportunity

Job Title: Director of Financial Planning and Analysis
Job Description:
Who Are We? QinetiQ Inc. is a leading innovator with over 25 years of experience rapidly developing advanced C5ISR sensor solutions and is a renowned world leader in robotics and autonomy. The combined QinetiQ U.S.

business unit brings capabilities across the full lifecycle of technology development from applied research and development to rapid prototyping, testing, fielding, and sustainment. Our expertise with unmanned platforms, broad sensing modalities, and cross-domain interoperability ensures that we deliver integrated solutions for Warfighter dominance in all phases of combat. We are a world-class team of professionals who deliver next generation technology and products in robotic and autonomous platforms and systems, ground systems, soldier systems, maritime systems, airborne sensors and payloads, processing and exploitation capabilities, and integrated C2 solutions. Much of our work contributes to innovative research in ﬁelds such as sensor science, signal processing, data fusion, artiﬁcial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML), and augmented reality (AR).

Our customers are always our number one priority and we consistently deliver Mission-Led Innovation to empower and protect our Defense and Security forces in the U.S. and abroad. QinetiQ Inc. C5ISR Solutions is looking for an experienced, colloborative financial professional to lead our financial planning & analysis function.

In this role the Director of Financial Planning & Analysis will contribute to our mission by doing the following: Your Contribution to Our Mission: Prepare annual profit and loss (" P& L"), indirect cost budgets, quarterly P&L forecasts and periodic indirect cost forecasts. Perform monthly reporting of actual versus budgeted performance of P&L, balance sheet and cash flow and supporting variance analysis (include in g program-level drivers). Prepare monthly indirect cost reports and variance to budget analysis for department heads and senior management. Conduct monthly reviews and quarterly executive reviews of same.

Ensure accurate monthly program-level budgeting for use by program managers and baseline input to business forecasts. Ensure appropriate revenue recognition for various contract types, including profit accrual. Prepare monthly funded and unfunded backlog reports. Provide program funding requirements to Program Offices and prepare the financial analysis required for work-at-risk request form on a timely basis.

Participate in annual strategic planning process, including development of estimating models and preparation of summary financial estimates. Prepare financial data and appropriate variance comments for presentation to the board of directors in addition to coordination/preparation of the board booklet. Scrutinize the indirect rate performance as part of monthly closing process and conduct monthly management meetings to discuss indirect cost performance versus budget. To Land This Job, You Need: 8-10+ years of work experience in financial planning & analysis, accounting, consulting, and/or corporate finance.

Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or Finance required, MBA is a plus. Exceptional financial modeling skills. Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy. Excellent analytical abilities, problem-solving skills and business acumen.

Exceptional written and verbal communications skills. Excellent project and time management abilities. Ability to work under pressure within short time constraints. Ability to effectively interact with all levels of management on financial related issues.

Strong Ability and clearly articulate financial material and analytics and provide guidance to leadership acting as a business partner. Job Type: Full Time Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain : DOD Secret Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain: DOD Secret Why QinetiQ Inc.? Your work will contribute to the protection of American Warfighters and Security Forces. Opportunity to work with cutting edge technology.

Extensive opportunities for continuous learning, professional growth and advancement. We only hire the best! No matter if you are entry or senior level, you will have the opportunity learn from some of the best in the industry. We have fun!

We regularly have company events, from luncheons and costume contests to golf tournaments. We care about YOU and YOUR FAMILY. We offer competitive benefits and health insurance options. No One Has Time for Long Job Applications!

We completely understand. That is why we have made the application process easy. We promise. This will be simple.

The Senior Manager supporting the Dunkin’ Advertising Fund will empower data-driven strategic decision making by creating, budgeting/forecasting, analyzing, reporting and communicating financial information into actionable insights for Finance & Marketing Leadership. In this position, the Senior Manager provides overall financial management leadership to the Dunkin’ U.S. marketing team by overseeing the financial modeling and analyses to track, forecast and report sales/revenue and Ad Spend, ultimately ensuring accurate reporting to Dunkin’ Leadership and franchisees; own processes, work independently and contribute to overall team success; support various groups within the organization including, but not limited to: Brand Marketing, Integrated/Field Marketing, Marketing Strategy, Digital Marketing, Franchisees, various Corporate Services segments and Finance. This Dunkin’ U.S. Senior Finance Manager role will also support other aspects of the Dunkin’ U.S. business in conjunction with, and in support of, the Finance Director - Dunkin’ U.S. as we continue to evolve and adapt to new business normal requirements and expectations of the COVID-19 environment. This role requires a professional and experienced Finance manager who displays the ability to adapt and improvise to the “needs at hand” to support all aspect of the business with sound financial acumen and management skills.

Financial Planning and Analysis Director leads the budgeting, forecasting, long-term planning, implementation, and business strategic analysis of the financial team.

Being a Financial Planning and Analysis Director reviews analysis results, develops insightful suggestions for investment, sourcing, cost reduction and leads strategic business decisions.
Requires a bachelor's degree.

Medisolv is seeking a Manager of Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A). Reporting to the Chief Financial Officer, this position will provide enterprise-wide leadership of the budgeting, forecasting, long-term planning, implementation, and strategic business analysis function. Further, they will review outcomes with an analytical mindset, develop thoughtful recommendations for strategic initiatives and provide cost management recommendations for business units.

Manage and develop strategic planning, performance metrics, management reporting, annual budgets, interim forecasts and financial analyses for the company
Conduct sensitivity analysis around broad and in-depth internal and external factors
Partner with executive management to enable informed decision making based on trends, analysis and “what-if” outcomes

Job Description
Are you an experienced Finance Manager looking for a new opportunity? Then come learn about our opening as a Senior Finance Manager. You will be supporting the Financial Planning & Analysis department with a primary focus of managing the Corporate General and Administrative Financial Operations segment.
What will I be doing:
The Finance Manager will lead the monthly, quarterly and annual processes and deliverables including, but not limited to, Operating forecasts, headcount tracking, management reporting, monthly and quarterly business reviews, statistical analysis, forecast reconciliations, allocations, Board presentations, investor relations support and American Resort Development Association (ARDA) surveys. You will provide ad-hoc expense analysis to support Business Units or any corporate initiatives while leading the consolidated review on expense execution against Budget/Forecast. The role will also play a key role in managing operating expense risk. This leader will assist with the coordination and preparation of the annual operating budgets. The Senior Manager will assist the department in ad-hoc analysis, advanced modeling, and other FP&A functions as needed. Secondary responsibilities will include maintaining and enhancing the company headcount management and tracking process.

Job Description:

The Director of Financial Planning and Analysis shall be accountable to and supervised by the CFO.
Ferraro Foods is a $1 billion revenue Italian fine foods distributor serving select chains, Italian restaurants, and the pizzeria segment. Ferraro Foods has a robust acquisition pipeline and will be an active acquirer over the next 2 years. The Director of FP&A role is responsible for leading the preparation of the annual budget, the projection of operating results, and the long-term financial projection for Ferraro Foods Mergers and Acquisitions.

Your Opportunity

Schwab Stock Plan Services (SPS) provides a variety of solutions to large, publicly traded companies for the administration of their Equity Compensation plans, including stock options, restricted stock, and employee stock purchase programs. SPS offers solutions for the administration of these plans up to and including full outsourcing capabilities for the recordkeeping and employee services. Our mission is to provide a world class experience for our clients and to provide the opportunity for the employees of our corporate clients to achieve their financial fitness goals. Stock Plan Services is seeking a Financial Reporting Manager who has a deep understanding of share-based payment concepts.

Will consider nationwide talent as workplace flexibility is available to include partial or permanent remote.

WHAT YOU'LL DO

The Northeast System is the largest system globally for BCG, consisting of six offices within the North America region: Boston, New York, New Jersey, Philadelphia, Pittsburgh, Washington DC. This role also includes our US federal government practice (Fed).

As a senior member of the Northeast system finance team, the FPA manager provides support to system leadership, office leadership, system partners, consulting and business services team. They will interact regularly with Managing Directors and Partners (MDPs) and other members of senior consulting staff.

In addition, you will be connected throughout BCG matrix informing internal functions about outlook and provide decision support to help make informed decisions. This includes building and managing a team of analyst that is fostering relationships across local offices, shared services, regional functions, SBU’s and global services, driving discussions, anticipating needs, providing insight, fielding adhoc analysis and data requests.

You will also be involved with many finance initiatives, including the multi year Future of Finance, being a thought partner with stakeholders, supporting communication and change management of tools, reporting, metrics and processes. Other finance initiatives also include multiyear planning and various P&L scenario modelling.






Members of our finance team are responsible for preserving the intellectual capital, assets, and integrity of BCG. We make a decisive impact on the firm’s direction, performance, and risk-management models. Finance jobs include accounting and reporting, planning and analysis, tax and treasury, financial systems, payroll, and executive compensation.

Job Title: Director of Financial Planning and Analysis
Job Description:
Who Are We? QinetiQ Inc. is a leading innovator with over 25 years of experience rapidly developing advanced C5ISR sensor solutions and is a renowned world leader in robotics and autonomy. The combined QinetiQ U.S.

business unit brings capabilities across the full lifecycle of technology development from applied research and development to rapid prototyping, testing, fielding, and sustainment. Our expertise with unmanned platforms, broad sensing modalities, and cross-domain interoperability ensures that we deliver integrated solutions for Warfighter dominance in all phases of combat. We are a world-class team of professionals who deliver next generation technology and products in robotic and autonomous platforms and systems, ground systems, soldier systems, maritime systems, airborne sensors and payloads, processing and exploitation capabilities, and integrated C2 solutions. Much of our work contributes to innovative research in ﬁelds such as sensor science, signal processing, data fusion, artiﬁcial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML), and augmented reality (AR).

Our customers are always our number one priority and we consistently deliver Mission-Led Innovation to empower and protect our Defense and Security forces in the U.S. and abroad. QinetiQ Inc. C5ISR Solutions is looking for an experienced, colloborative financial professional to lead our financial planning & analysis function.

In this role the Director of Financial Planning & Analysis will contribute to our mission by doing the following: Your Contribution to Our Mission: Prepare annual profit and loss (" P& L"), indirect cost budgets, quarterly P&L forecasts and periodic indirect cost forecasts. Perform monthly reporting of actual versus budgeted performance of P&L, balance sheet and cash flow and supporting variance analysis (include in g program-level drivers). Prepare monthly indirect cost reports and variance to budget analysis for department heads and senior management. Conduct monthly reviews and quarterly executive reviews of same.

Ensure accurate monthly program-level budgeting for use by program managers and baseline input to business forecasts. Ensure appropriate revenue recognition for various contract types, including profit accrual. Prepare monthly funded and unfunded backlog reports. Provide program funding requirements to Program Offices and prepare the financial analysis required for work-at-risk request form on a timely basis.

Participate in annual strategic planning process, including development of estimating models and preparation of summary financial estimates. Prepare financial data and appropriate variance comments for presentation to the board of directors in addition to coordination/preparation of the board booklet. Scrutinize the indirect rate performance as part of monthly closing process and conduct monthly management meetings to discuss indirect cost performance versus budget. To Land This Job, You Need: 8-10+ years of work experience in financial planning & analysis, accounting, consulting, and/or corporate finance.

POSITION OVERVIEW
The SVP of Finance and Administration oversees and leads Camp Fire’s internal finance and administrative functions as well as builds and manages the systems needed to ensure organizational health and stability. This role is charged with transforming and enhancing existing financial and administrative functions to the next level of performance during a period of significant change in the organization. The SVP reports directly to the President & CEO and serves as a key member of the executive team. This individual will partner with senior leadership and the Board of Directors to develop and implement sustainable, innovative and fiscally responsible strategies across the organization. This team player must demonstrate the ability to adapt to a continually evolving environment and possess superior leadership, communication and creative problem-solving skills.

Your Job
Indeed is seeking a highly motivated Manager to join our rapidly growing Financial Planning and Analysis team. You will assist with global financial operations, working collaboratively with a range of cross-functional partners to enable strategic decision-making.

You approach projects with a flexible, innovative, service-oriented mindset, and a strong emphasis on system-based solutions. You possess an analytical mind, an ability to communicate complex ideas to senior business leaders, and a desire to make a meaningful impact on a dynamic, high-growth technology company. This position oversees a team of FP&A Analysts and reports to the Director of FP&A.

Responsibilities


Our Finance team ensures that Indeed follows the highest standards of business, law and ethics to help us succeed around the world. Our goal is to provide excellent customer service to internal and external clients while helping our management team make decisions using the most relevant and accurate information available.

This Dunkin’ U.S. Senior Finance Manager role will also support other aspects of the Dunkin’ U.S. business in conjunction with, and in support of, the Finance Director - Dunkin’ U.S. as we continue to evolve and adapt to new business normal requirements and expectations of the COVID-19 environment. This role requires a professional and experienced Finance manager who displays the ability to adapt and improvise to the “needs at hand” to support all aspect of the business with sound financial acumen and management skills.

Director of Financial Planning and Analysis Job Duties:

Job Description
Are you an experienced Finance Manager looking for a new opportunity? Then come learn about our opening as a Senior Finance Manager. You will be supporting the Financial Planning & Analysis department with a primary focus of managing the Corporate General and Administrative Financial Operations segment.
What will I be doing:
The Finance Manager will lead the monthly, quarterly and annual processes and deliverables including, but not limited to, Operating forecasts, headcount tracking, management reporting, monthly and quarterly business reviews, statistical analysis, forecast reconciliations, allocations, Board presentations, investor relations support and American Resort Development Association (ARDA) surveys. You will provide ad-hoc expense analysis to support Business Units or any corporate initiatives while leading the consolidated review on expense execution against Budget/Forecast. The role will also play a key role in managing operating expense risk. This leader will assist with the coordination and preparation of the annual operating budgets. The Senior Manager will assist the department in ad-hoc analysis, advanced modeling, and other FP&A functions as needed. Secondary responsibilities will include maintaining and enhancing the company headcount management and tracking process.

WHAT YOU'LL DO

The Northeast System is the largest system globally for BCG, consisting of six offices within the North America region: Boston, New York, New Jersey, Philadelphia, Pittsburgh, Washington DC. This role also includes our US federal government practice (Fed).

Job Title: Director of Financial Planning and Analysis
Job Description:
Who Are We? QinetiQ Inc. is a leading innovator with over 25 years of experience rapidly developing advanced C5ISR sensor solutions and is a renowned world leader in robotics and autonomy. The combined QinetiQ U.S.

business unit brings capabilities across the full lifecycle of technology development from applied research and development to rapid prototyping, testing, fielding, and sustainment. Our expertise with unmanned platforms, broad sensing modalities, and cross-domain interoperability ensures that we deliver integrated solutions for Warfighter dominance in all phases of combat. We are a world-class team of professionals who deliver next generation technology and products in robotic and autonomous platforms and systems, ground systems, soldier systems, maritime systems, airborne sensors and payloads, processing and exploitation capabilities, and integrated C2 solutions. Much of our work contributes to innovative research in ﬁelds such as sensor science, signal processing, data fusion, artiﬁcial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML), and augmented reality (AR).

Our customers are always our number one priority and we consistently deliver Mission-Led Innovation to empower and protect our Defense and Security forces in the U.S. and abroad. QinetiQ Inc. C5ISR Solutions is looking for an experienced, colloborative financial professional to lead our financial planning & analysis function.

In this role the Director of Financial Planning & Analysis will contribute to our mission by doing the following: Your Contribution to Our Mission: Prepare annual profit and loss (" P& L"), indirect cost budgets, quarterly P&L forecasts and periodic indirect cost forecasts. Perform monthly reporting of actual versus budgeted performance of P&L, balance sheet and cash flow and supporting variance analysis (include in g program-level drivers). Prepare monthly indirect cost reports and variance to budget analysis for department heads and senior management. Conduct monthly reviews and quarterly executive reviews of same.

Ensure accurate monthly program-level budgeting for use by program managers and baseline input to business forecasts. Ensure appropriate revenue recognition for various contract types, including profit accrual. Prepare monthly funded and unfunded backlog reports. Provide program funding requirements to Program Offices and prepare the financial analysis required for work-at-risk request form on a timely basis.

Participate in annual strategic planning process, including development of estimating models and preparation of summary financial estimates. Prepare financial data and appropriate variance comments for presentation to the board of directors in addition to coordination/preparation of the board booklet. Scrutinize the indirect rate performance as part of monthly closing process and conduct monthly management meetings to discuss indirect cost performance versus budget. To Land This Job, You Need: 8-10+ years of work experience in financial planning & analysis, accounting, consulting, and/or corporate finance.

Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or Finance required, MBA is a plus. Exceptional financial modeling skills. Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy. Excellent analytical abilities, problem-solving skills and business acumen.

Exceptional written and verbal communications skills. Excellent project and time management abilities. Ability to work under pressure within short time constraints. Ability to effectively interact with all levels of management on financial related issues.

Strong Ability and clearly articulate financial material and analytics and provide guidance to leadership acting as a business partner. Job Type: Full Time Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain : DOD Secret Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain: DOD Secret Why QinetiQ Inc.? Your work will contribute to the protection of American Warfighters and Security Forces. Opportunity to work with cutting edge technology.

Extensive opportunities for continuous learning, professional growth and advancement. We only hire the best! No matter if you are entry or senior level, you will have the opportunity learn from some of the best in the industry. We have fun!

We regularly have company events, from luncheons and costume contests to golf tournaments. We care about YOU and YOUR FAMILY. We offer competitive benefits and health insurance options. No One Has Time for Long Job Applications!

We completely understand. That is why we have made the application process easy. We promise. This will be simple.

If because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to staffing@us.qinetiq.com or call (540) 658-2720 Opt 4 and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

Human Interest is on a mission to ensure that people in all lines of work have access to retirement benefits.
Social Security, our nation's retirement safety net, is projected to be insolvent as soon as 2035, making employer-sponsored 401(k) plans the primary retirement savings vehicle in the U.S. Nearly half of all working Americans are not saving enough for their future because they are employed by a company that doesn't offer a retirement plan. Human Interest is changing that by making it affordable and accessible for small and medium sized businesses to offer employees a path to financial independence through retirement savings.
Our values are the guiding principles we use to build solutions for plan administrators and participants. They reflect our point of view on what's important and what's right:
In it for customers, autonomous & accountable, outcomes driven, inclusive collaboration, and decisive.

Imagine...working for a company that knows that its people are the key to its success in the marketplace. A company in which achieving extraordinary results and having a stimulating work experience are part of the same process.

GENERAL SUMMARY:
Reporting to one of the Directors within Corporate FP&A, this position provides value-added analytical support and insights for the Company’s Strategic and Operating plan, as well as a wide range of corporate projects and initiatives. This role develops and owns the model underlying the Company’s long-term financial algorithm, providing insights and support for capital allocation and resource planning. This individual will have significant interaction with senior Campbell leadership including the CFO and his direct team.

Financial Planning and Analysis Director leads the budgeting, forecasting, long-term planning, implementation, and business strategic analysis of the financial team.
Conducts financial analysis, modeling, forecasting and reporting efforts to ensure efficient financial operations.
Being a Financial Planning and Analysis Director reviews analysis results, develops insightful suggestions for investment, sourcing, cost reduction and leads strategic business decisions.
Requires a bachelor's degree.
Additionally, Financial Planning and Analysis Director typically reports to top management or CFO.

WHAT YOU'LL DO

The Northeast System is the largest system globally for BCG, consisting of six offices within the North America region: Boston, New York, New Jersey, Philadelphia, Pittsburgh, Washington DC. This role also includes our US federal government practice (Fed).

As a senior member of the Northeast system finance team, the FPA manager provides support to system leadership, office leadership, system partners, consulting and business services team. They will interact regularly with Managing Directors and Partners (MDPs) and other members of senior consulting staff.

In addition, you will be connected throughout BCG matrix informing internal functions about outlook and provide decision support to help make informed decisions. This includes building and managing a team of analyst that is fostering relationships across local offices, shared services, regional functions, SBU’s and global services, driving discussions, anticipating needs, providing insight, fielding adhoc analysis and data requests.

You will also be involved with many finance initiatives, including the multi year Future of Finance, being a thought partner with stakeholders, supporting communication and change management of tools, reporting, metrics and processes. Other finance initiatives also include multiyear planning and various P&L scenario modelling.






Members of our finance team are responsible for preserving the intellectual capital, assets, and integrity of BCG. We make a decisive impact on the firm’s direction, performance, and risk-management models. Finance jobs include accounting and reporting, planning and analysis, tax and treasury, financial systems, payroll, and executive compensation.

Very well-respected, global, private company

Job Title: Director of Financial Planning and Analysis
Job Description:
Who Are We? QinetiQ Inc. is a leading innovator with over 25 years of experience rapidly developing advanced C5ISR sensor solutions and is a renowned world leader in robotics and autonomy. The combined QinetiQ U.S.

business unit brings capabilities across the full lifecycle of technology development from applied research and development to rapid prototyping, testing, fielding, and sustainment. Our expertise with unmanned platforms, broad sensing modalities, and cross-domain interoperability ensures that we deliver integrated solutions for Warfighter dominance in all phases of combat. We are a world-class team of professionals who deliver next generation technology and products in robotic and autonomous platforms and systems, ground systems, soldier systems, maritime systems, airborne sensors and payloads, processing and exploitation capabilities, and integrated C2 solutions. Much of our work contributes to innovative research in ﬁelds such as sensor science, signal processing, data fusion, artiﬁcial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML), and augmented reality (AR).

Our customers are always our number one priority and we consistently deliver Mission-Led Innovation to empower and protect our Defense and Security forces in the U.S. and abroad. QinetiQ Inc. C5ISR Solutions is looking for an experienced, colloborative financial professional to lead our financial planning & analysis function.

In this role the Director of Financial Planning & Analysis will contribute to our mission by doing the following: Your Contribution to Our Mission: Prepare annual profit and loss (" P& L"), indirect cost budgets, quarterly P&L forecasts and periodic indirect cost forecasts. Perform monthly reporting of actual versus budgeted performance of P&L, balance sheet and cash flow and supporting variance analysis (include in g program-level drivers). Prepare monthly indirect cost reports and variance to budget analysis for department heads and senior management. Conduct monthly reviews and quarterly executive reviews of same.

Ensure accurate monthly program-level budgeting for use by program managers and baseline input to business forecasts. Ensure appropriate revenue recognition for various contract types, including profit accrual. Prepare monthly funded and unfunded backlog reports. Provide program funding requirements to Program Offices and prepare the financial analysis required for work-at-risk request form on a timely basis.

Participate in annual strategic planning process, including development of estimating models and preparation of summary financial estimates. Prepare financial data and appropriate variance comments for presentation to the board of directors in addition to coordination/preparation of the board booklet. Scrutinize the indirect rate performance as part of monthly closing process and conduct monthly management meetings to discuss indirect cost performance versus budget. To Land This Job, You Need: 8-10+ years of work experience in financial planning & analysis, accounting, consulting, and/or corporate finance.

Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or Finance required, MBA is a plus. Exceptional financial modeling skills. Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy. Excellent analytical abilities, problem-solving skills and business acumen.

Exceptional written and verbal communications skills. Excellent project and time management abilities. Ability to work under pressure within short time constraints. Ability to effectively interact with all levels of management on financial related issues.

Strong Ability and clearly articulate financial material and analytics and provide guidance to leadership acting as a business partner. Job Type: Full Time Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain : DOD Secret Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain: DOD Secret Why QinetiQ Inc.? Your work will contribute to the protection of American Warfighters and Security Forces. Opportunity to work with cutting edge technology.

Extensive opportunities for continuous learning, professional growth and advancement. We only hire the best! No matter if you are entry or senior level, you will have the opportunity learn from some of the best in the industry. We have fun!

We regularly have company events, from luncheons and costume contests to golf tournaments. We care about YOU and YOUR FAMILY. We offer competitive benefits and health insurance options. No One Has Time for Long Job Applications!

The Senior Manager supporting the Dunkin’ Advertising Fund will empower data-driven strategic decision making by creating, budgeting/forecasting, analyzing, reporting and communicating financial information into actionable insights for Finance & Marketing Leadership. This Dunkin’ U.S. Senior Finance Manager role will also support other aspects of the Dunkin’ U.S. business in conjunction with, and in support of, the Finance Director - Dunkin’ U.S. as we continue to evolve and adapt to new business normal requirements and expectations of the COVID-19 environment. This role requires a professional and experienced Finance manager who displays the ability to adapt and improvise to the “needs at hand” to support all aspect of the business with sound financial acumen and management skills.

Medisolv is seeking a Manager of Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A). Reporting to the Chief Financial Officer, this position will provide enterprise-wide leadership of the budgeting, forecasting, long-term planning, implementation, and strategic business analysis function. They will lead financial analysis, modeling, forecasting, pricing analysis, and financial reporting to ensure efficient business operations. Further, they will review outcomes with an analytical mindset, develop thoughtful recommendations for strategic initiatives and provide cost management recommendations for business units.
Essential Functions:
Manage and develop strategic planning, performance metrics, management reporting, annual budgets, interim forecasts and financial analyses for the company
Conduct sensitivity analysis around broad and in-depth internal and external factors
Partner with executive management to enable informed decision making based on trends, analysis and “what-if” outcomes

Job Description
Are you an experienced Finance Manager looking for a new opportunity? Then come learn about our opening as a Senior Finance Manager. You will be supporting the Financial Planning & Analysis department with a primary focus of managing the Corporate General and Administrative Financial Operations segment.

The Finance Manager will lead the monthly, quarterly and annual processes and deliverables including, but not limited to, Operating forecasts, headcount tracking, management reporting, monthly and quarterly business reviews, statistical analysis, forecast reconciliations, allocations, Board presentations, investor relations support and American Resort Development Association (ARDA) surveys. Secondary responsibilities will include maintaining and enhancing the company headcount management and tracking process.

Human Interest is on a mission to ensure that people in all lines of work have access to retirement benefits.
Social Security, our nation's retirement safety net, is projected to be insolvent as soon as 2035, making employer-sponsored 401(k) plans the primary retirement savings vehicle in the U.S. Nearly half of all working Americans are not saving enough for their future because they are employed by a company that doesn't offer a retirement plan. Human Interest is changing that by making it affordable and accessible for small and medium sized businesses to offer employees a path to financial independence through retirement savings.
Our values are the guiding principles we use to build solutions for plan administrators and participants. They reflect our point of view on what's important and what's right:
In it for customers, autonomous & accountable, outcomes driven, inclusive collaboration, and decisive.

In the spirit of collaboration, excellence, and innovation, we at Linc housing are committed to building and preserving housing that is affordable, environmentally sustainable and a catalyst for community improvement. Our team works hard to address California’s homelessness crisis by building supportive housing and addressing the affordable housing needs of California’s diverse population.
We are proud of and inspired by our mission to build communities and strengthen neighborhoods for people underserved by the marketplace. Our feats could not have been achieved without the resilience and drive for excellence put forth by our team. If you are interested in joining a team of dedicated, caring, and talented individuals inspired to make change, you have found the right place.

Financial Planning and Analysis Manager

Your Opportunity

Schwab Stock Plan Services (SPS) provides a variety of solutions to large, publicly traded companies for the administration of their Equity Compensation plans, including stock options, restricted stock, and employee stock purchase programs. SPS offers solutions for the administration of these plans up to and including full outsourcing capabilities for the recordkeeping and employee services. Financial Planning and Analysis Director leads the budgeting, forecasting, long-term planning, implementation, and business strategic analysis of the financial team.
Conducts financial analysis, modeling, forecasting and reporting efforts to ensure efficient financial operations.
Being a Financial Planning and Analysis Director reviews analysis results, develops insightful suggestions for investment, sourcing, cost reduction and leads strategic business decisions.
Requires a bachelor's degree.
Additionally, Financial Planning and Analysis Director typically reports to top management or CFO.

WHAT YOU'LL DO

The Northeast System is the largest system globally for BCG, consisting of six offices within the North America region: Boston, New York, New Jersey, Philadelphia, Pittsburgh, Washington DC. This role also includes our US federal government practice (Fed).

As a senior member of the Northeast system finance team, the FPA manager provides support to system leadership, office leadership, system partners, consulting and business services team. They will interact regularly with Managing Directors and Partners (MDPs) and other members of senior consulting staff.

In addition, you will be connected throughout BCG matrix informing internal functions about outlook and provide decision support to help make informed decisions. This includes building and managing a team of analyst that is fostering relationships across local offices, shared services, regional functions, SBU’s and global services, driving discussions, anticipating needs, providing insight, fielding adhoc analysis and data requests.

Job Title: Director of Financial Planning and Analysis
Job Description:
Who Are We? QinetiQ Inc. is a leading innovator with over 25 years of experience rapidly developing advanced C5ISR sensor solutions and is a renowned world leader in robotics and autonomy. The combined QinetiQ U.S.

business unit brings capabilities across the full lifecycle of technology development from applied research and development to rapid prototyping, testing, fielding, and sustainment. Our expertise with unmanned platforms, broad sensing modalities, and cross-domain interoperability ensures that we deliver integrated solutions for Warfighter dominance in all phases of combat. We are a world-class team of professionals who deliver next generation technology and products in robotic and autonomous platforms and systems, ground systems, soldier systems, maritime systems, airborne sensors and payloads, processing and exploitation capabilities, and integrated C2 solutions. Much of our work contributes to innovative research in ﬁelds such as sensor science, signal processing, data fusion, artiﬁcial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML), and augmented reality (AR).

Our customers are always our number one priority and we consistently deliver Mission-Led Innovation to empower and protect our Defense and Security forces in the U.S. and abroad. QinetiQ Inc. C5ISR Solutions is looking for an experienced, colloborative financial professional to lead our financial planning & analysis function.

In this role the Director of Financial Planning & Analysis will contribute to our mission by doing the following: Your Contribution to Our Mission: Prepare annual profit and loss (" P& L"), indirect cost budgets, quarterly P&L forecasts and periodic indirect cost forecasts. Perform monthly reporting of actual versus budgeted performance of P&L, balance sheet and cash flow and supporting variance analysis (include in g program-level drivers). Prepare monthly indirect cost reports and variance to budget analysis for department heads and senior management. Conduct monthly reviews and quarterly executive reviews of same.

Ensure accurate monthly program-level budgeting for use by program managers and baseline input to business forecasts. Ensure appropriate revenue recognition for various contract types, including profit accrual. Prepare monthly funded and unfunded backlog reports. Provide program funding requirements to Program Offices and prepare the financial analysis required for work-at-risk request form on a timely basis.

Participate in annual strategic planning process, including development of estimating models and preparation of summary financial estimates. Prepare financial data and appropriate variance comments for presentation to the board of directors in addition to coordination/preparation of the board booklet. Scrutinize the indirect rate performance as part of monthly closing process and conduct monthly management meetings to discuss indirect cost performance versus budget. To Land This Job, You Need: 8-10+ years of work experience in financial planning & analysis, accounting, consulting, and/or corporate finance.

Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or Finance required, MBA is a plus. Exceptional financial modeling skills. Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy. Excellent analytical abilities, problem-solving skills and business acumen.

Exceptional written and verbal communications skills. Excellent project and time management abilities. Ability to work under pressure within short time constraints. Ability to effectively interact with all levels of management on financial related issues.

Strong Ability and clearly articulate financial material and analytics and provide guidance to leadership acting as a business partner. Job Type: Full Time Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain : DOD Secret Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain: DOD Secret Why QinetiQ Inc.? Your work will contribute to the protection of American Warfighters and Security Forces. Opportunity to work with cutting edge technology.

Extensive opportunities for continuous learning, professional growth and advancement. We only hire the best! No matter if you are entry or senior level, you will have the opportunity learn from some of the best in the industry. We have fun!

We regularly have company events, from luncheons and costume contests to golf tournaments. We care about YOU and YOUR FAMILY. We offer competitive benefits and health insurance options. No One Has Time for Long Job Applications!

We completely understand. That is why we have made the application process easy. We promise. This will be simple.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

Human Interest is on a mission to ensure that people in all lines of work have access to retirement benefits.
Social Security, our nation's retirement safety net, is projected to be insolvent as soon as 2035, making employer-sponsored 401(k) plans the primary retirement savings vehicle in the U.S. Nearly half of all working Americans are not saving enough for their future because they are employed by a company that doesn't offer a retirement plan. Human Interest is changing that by making it affordable and accessible for small and medium sized businesses to offer employees a path to financial independence through retirement savings.
Our values are the guiding principles we use to build solutions for plan administrators and participants. They reflect our point of view on what's important and what's right:
In it for customers, autonomous & accountable, outcomes driven, inclusive collaboration, and decisive.

Director of Financial Planning and Analysis Job Duties:

Human Interest is on a mission to ensure that people in all lines of work have access to retirement benefits.
Social Security, our nation's retirement safety net, is projected to be insolvent as soon as 2035, making employer-sponsored 401(k) plans the primary retirement savings vehicle in the U.S. Nearly half of all working Americans are not saving enough for their future because they are employed by a company that doesn't offer a retirement plan. Human Interest is changing that by making it affordable and accessible for small and medium sized businesses to offer employees a path to financial independence through retirement savings.
Our values are the guiding principles we use to build solutions for plan administrators and participants. They reflect our point of view on what's important and what's right:
In it for customers, autonomous & accountable, outcomes driven, inclusive collaboration, and decisive.

Medisolv is seeking a Manager of Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A). Reporting to the Chief Financial Officer, this position will provide enterprise-wide leadership of the budgeting, forecasting, long-term planning, implementation, and strategic business analysis function. They will lead financial analysis, modeling, forecasting, pricing analysis, and financial reporting to ensure efficient business operations. Further, they will review outcomes with an analytical mindset, develop thoughtful recommendations for strategic initiatives and provide cost management recommendations for business units.
Essential Functions:
Manage and develop strategic planning, performance metrics, management reporting, annual budgets, interim forecasts and financial analyses for the company
Conduct sensitivity analysis around broad and in-depth internal and external factors
Partner with executive management to enable informed decision making based on trends, analysis and “what-if” outcomes

Job Description
Are you an experienced Finance Manager looking for a new opportunity? Then come learn about our opening as a Senior Finance Manager. You will be supporting the Financial Planning & Analysis department with a primary focus of managing the Corporate General and Administrative Financial Operations segment.
What will I be doing:
The Finance Manager will lead the monthly, quarterly and annual processes and deliverables including, but not limited to, Operating forecasts, headcount tracking, management reporting, monthly and quarterly business reviews, statistical analysis, forecast reconciliations, allocations, Board presentations, investor relations support and American Resort Development Association (ARDA) surveys. You will provide ad-hoc expense analysis to support Business Units or any corporate initiatives while leading the consolidated review on expense execution against Budget/Forecast. The role will also play a key role in managing operating expense risk. This leader will assist with the coordination and preparation of the annual operating budgets. The Senior Manager will assist the department in ad-hoc analysis, advanced modeling, and other FP&A functions as needed. Secondary responsibilities will include maintaining and enhancing the company headcount management and tracking process.

Operating within the Corporate Finance function, the Senior Manager, FP&A is a key member of Vertex's Financial Planning & Analysis team, providing financial direction and strategic insight including identification of key value drivers and Business KPIs, helping the organization deliver on long-term goals and influencing strategy. This role will help drive our annual long-range planning process and will partner closely with functional teams to consolidate and analyze enterprise portfolio financial metrics (profitability, valuations, scenarios, etc.), with a focus on influencing business strategy and decisions through an understanding of the key drivers of long-term performance, enterprise value and communicating the range of possible outcomes. The best candidate will also endeavor to identify process improvement opportunities and will collaborate with functional teams to ensure standardization where appropriate.

Your Job
Indeed is seeking a highly motivated Manager to join our rapidly growing Financial Planning and Analysis team. You will assist with global financial operations, working collaboratively with a range of cross-functional partners to enable strategic decision-making.

You approach projects with a flexible, innovative, service-oriented mindset, and a strong emphasis on system-based solutions. You possess an analytical mind, an ability to communicate complex ideas to senior business leaders, and a desire to make a meaningful impact on a dynamic, high-growth technology company. This position oversees a team of FP&A Analysts and reports to the Director of FP&A.

Responsibilities


Our Finance team ensures that Indeed follows the highest standards of business, law and ethics to help us succeed around the world. Our goal is to provide excellent customer service to internal and external clients while helping our management team make decisions using the most relevant and accurate information available.

POSITION OVERVIEW
The SVP of Finance and Administration oversees and leads Camp Fire’s internal finance and administrative functions as well as builds and manages the systems needed to ensure organizational health and stability. This role is charged with transforming and enhancing existing financial and administrative functions to the next level of performance during a period of significant change in the organization. The SVP reports directly to the President & CEO and serves as a key member of the executive team. This individual will partner with senior leadership and the Board of Directors to develop and implement sustainable, innovative and fiscally responsible strategies across the organization. This team player must demonstrate the ability to adapt to a continually evolving environment and possess superior leadership, communication and creative problem-solving skills.

The Senior Manager supporting the Dunkin’ Advertising Fund will empower data-driven strategic decision making by creating, budgeting/forecasting, analyzing, reporting and communicating financial information into actionable insights for Finance & Marketing Leadership. In this position, the Senior Manager provides overall financial management leadership to the Dunkin’ U.S. marketing team by overseeing the financial modeling and analyses to track, forecast and report sales/revenue and Ad Spend, ultimately ensuring accurate reporting to Dunkin’ Leadership and franchisees; own processes, work independently and contribute to overall team success; support various groups within the organization including, but not limited to: Brand Marketing, Integrated/Field Marketing, Marketing Strategy, Digital Marketing, Franchisees, various Corporate Services segments and Finance. This Dunkin’ U.S. Senior Finance Manager role will also support other aspects of the Dunkin’ U.S. business in conjunction with, and in support of, the Finance Director - Dunkin’ U.S. as we continue to evolve and adapt to new business normal requirements and expectations of the COVID-19 environment. This role requires a professional and experienced Finance manager who displays the ability to adapt and improvise to the “needs at hand” to support all aspect of the business with sound financial acumen and management skills.

Human Interest is on a mission to ensure that people in all lines of work have access to retirement benefits.
Social Security, our nation's retirement safety net, is projected to be insolvent as soon as 2035, making employer-sponsored 401(k) plans the primary retirement savings vehicle in the U.S. Nearly half of all working Americans are not saving enough for their future because they are employed by a company that doesn't offer a retirement plan. Human Interest is changing that by making it affordable and accessible for small and medium sized businesses to offer employees a path to financial independence through retirement savings.
Our values are the guiding principles we use to build solutions for plan administrators and participants. They reflect our point of view on what's important and what's right:
In it for customers, autonomous & accountable, outcomes driven, inclusive collaboration, and decisive.

Medisolv is seeking a Manager of Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A). Reporting to the Chief Financial Officer, this position will provide enterprise-wide leadership of the budgeting, forecasting, long-term planning, implementation, and strategic business analysis function. They will lead financial analysis, modeling, forecasting, pricing analysis, and financial reporting to ensure efficient business operations. Further, they will review outcomes with an analytical mindset, develop thoughtful recommendations for strategic initiatives and provide cost management recommendations for business units.
Essential Functions:
Manage and develop strategic planning, performance metrics, management reporting, annual budgets, interim forecasts and financial analyses for the company
Conduct sensitivity analysis around broad and in-depth internal and external factors
Partner with executive management to enable informed decision making based on trends, analysis and “what-if” outcomes

Job Description
Are you an experienced Finance Manager looking for a new opportunity? Then come learn about our opening as a Senior Finance Manager. You will be supporting the Financial Planning & Analysis department with a primary focus of managing the Corporate General and Administrative Financial Operations segment.
What will I be doing:
The Finance Manager will lead the monthly, quarterly and annual processes and deliverables including, but not limited to, Operating forecasts, headcount tracking, management reporting, monthly and quarterly business reviews, statistical analysis, forecast reconciliations, allocations, Board presentations, investor relations support and American Resort Development Association (ARDA) surveys. You will provide ad-hoc expense analysis to support Business Units or any corporate initiatives while leading the consolidated review on expense execution against Budget/Forecast. The role will also play a key role in managing operating expense risk. This leader will assist with the coordination and preparation of the annual operating budgets. The Senior Manager will assist the department in ad-hoc analysis, advanced modeling, and other FP&A functions as needed. Secondary responsibilities will include maintaining and enhancing the company headcount management and tracking process.

Why a Great Opportunity
Our client is one of the largest property management firm in the USA with 325+ communities in more than 26 states, theyve grown to become one of the countrys largest management companies through their commitment to their own residents.

Human Interest is on a mission to ensure that people in all lines of work have access to retirement benefits.
Social Security, our nation's retirement safety net, is projected to be insolvent as soon as 2035, making employer-sponsored 401(k) plans the primary retirement savings vehicle in the U.S. Nearly half of all working Americans are not saving enough for their future because they are employed by a company that doesn't offer a retirement plan. Human Interest is changing that by making it affordable and accessible for small and medium sized businesses to offer employees a path to financial independence through retirement savings.
Our values are the guiding principles we use to build solutions for plan administrators and participants. They reflect our point of view on what's important and what's right:
In it for customers, autonomous & accountable, outcomes driven, inclusive collaboration, and decisive.

Your Opportunity

Schwab Stock Plan Services (SPS) provides a variety of solutions to large, publicly traded companies for the administration of their Equity Compensation plans, including stock options, restricted stock, and employee stock purchase programs. SPS offers solutions for the administration of these plans up to and including full outsourcing capabilities for the recordkeeping and employee services. Our mission is to provide a world class experience for our clients and to provide the opportunity for the employees of our corporate clients to achieve their financial fitness goals. Stock Plan Services is seeking a Financial Reporting Manager who has a deep understanding of share-based payment concepts.

Will consider nationwide talent as workplace flexibility is available to include partial or permanent remote.

WHAT YOU'LL DO

The Northeast System is the largest system globally for BCG, consisting of six offices within the North America region: Boston, New York, New Jersey, Philadelphia, Pittsburgh, Washington DC. This role also includes our US federal government practice (Fed).

As a senior member of the Northeast system finance team, the FPA manager provides support to system leadership, office leadership, system partners, consulting and business services team. They will interact regularly with Managing Directors and Partners (MDPs) and other members of senior consulting staff.

In addition, you will be connected throughout BCG matrix informing internal functions about outlook and provide decision support to help make informed decisions. This includes building and managing a team of analyst that is fostering relationships across local offices, shared services, regional functions, SBU’s and global services, driving discussions, anticipating needs, providing insight, fielding adhoc analysis and data requests.

You will also be involved with many finance initiatives, including the multi year Future of Finance, being a thought partner with stakeholders, supporting communication and change management of tools, reporting, metrics and processes. Other finance initiatives also include multiyear planning and various P&L scenario modelling.






Members of our finance team are responsible for preserving the intellectual capital, assets, and integrity of BCG. We make a decisive impact on the firm’s direction, performance, and risk-management models. Finance jobs include accounting and reporting, planning and analysis, tax and treasury, financial systems, payroll, and executive compensation.

POSITION OVERVIEW
The SVP of Finance and Administration oversees and leads Camp Fire’s internal finance and administrative functions as well as builds and manages the systems needed to ensure organizational health and stability. This role is charged with transforming and enhancing existing financial and administrative functions to the next level of performance during a period of significant change in the organization. The SVP reports directly to the President & CEO and serves as a key member of the executive team. This individual will partner with senior leadership and the Board of Directors to develop and implement sustainable, innovative and fiscally responsible strategies across the organization. This team player must demonstrate the ability to adapt to a continually evolving environment and possess superior leadership, communication and creative problem-solving skills.

The Senior Manager supporting the Dunkin’ Advertising Fund will empower data-driven strategic decision making by creating, budgeting/forecasting, analyzing, reporting and communicating financial information into actionable insights for Finance & Marketing Leadership. In this position, the Senior Manager provides overall financial management leadership to the Dunkin’ U.S. marketing team by overseeing the financial modeling and analyses to track, forecast and report sales/revenue and Ad Spend, ultimately ensuring accurate reporting to Dunkin’ Leadership and franchisees; own processes, work independently and contribute to overall team success; support various groups within the organization including, but not limited to: Brand Marketing, Integrated/Field Marketing, Marketing Strategy, Digital Marketing, Franchisees, various Corporate Services segments and Finance. Job Description:
Human Interest is on a mission to ensure that people in all lines of work have access to retirement benefits.
Social Security, our nation's retirement safety net, is projected to be insolvent as soon as 2035, making employer-sponsored 401(k) plans the primary retirement savings vehicle in the U.S. Nearly half of all working Americans are not saving enough for their future because they are employed by a company that doesn't offer a retirement plan. Human Interest is changing that by making it affordable and accessible for small and medium sized businesses to offer employees a path to financial independence through retirement savings.
Our values are the guiding principles we use to build solutions for plan administrators and participants. They reflect our point of view on what's important and what's right:
In it for customers, autonomous & accountable, outcomes driven, inclusive collaboration, and decisive.

Medisolv is seeking a Manager of Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A). Reporting to the Chief Financial Officer, this position will provide enterprise-wide leadership of the budgeting, forecasting, long-term planning, implementation, and strategic business analysis function. They will lead financial analysis, modeling, forecasting, pricing analysis, and financial reporting to ensure efficient business operations. Further, they will review outcomes with an analytical mindset, develop thoughtful recommendations for strategic initiatives and provide cost management recommendations for business units.

Manage and develop strategic planning, performance metrics, management reporting, annual budgets, interim forecasts and financial analyses for the company
Conduct sensitivity analysis around broad and in-depth internal and external factors
Partner with executive management to enable informed decision making based on trends, analysis and “what-if” outcomes

The Clinical and Translactional Science Institute (CTSI) is seeking a dynamic individual to be responsible for the financial management functions of the CTSI. Funding sources include federal and institutional support. This individual will participate with CTSI leadership in preparing budgets and setting department goals. Performs a variety of accounting duties that range in level of complexity. Prepares and anyalyzes financial information, reports, and statements based on derived statistics and analysis performed.

The CTSI is home for clinical and translational science in our institutions, the state of Utah, and within the Mountain West Region. It builds on our strengths in genetics and bioinformatics to translate promising bench science into practices that improve human health. 1. Develops and implements customer service, human resources and financial objectives for assigned departments consistent with the University’s goals and objectives.

3. Analyzes and forecasts revenue and expenditure trends. Provides monthly financial reports to leadership.
4. Assumes authority and performs functions of the department director in his/her absence.

May authorize exceptions to department policy and procedures related to assigned departments. Ensures compliance with Federal and state regulations.
6. Establishes internal objectives and implements procedures to meet goals. Assists in setting department short and long-term goals.

9. Facilitates cooperative and collaborative relationships with the community and other institutions.

13. CTSA Post award project managment.

Human Interest is on a mission to ensure that people in all lines of work have access to retirement benefits.
Social Security, our nation's retirement safety net, is projected to be insolvent as soon as 2035, making employer-sponsored 401(k) plans the primary retirement savings vehicle in the U.S. Nearly half of all working Americans are not saving enough for their future because they are employed by a company that doesn't offer a retirement plan. Human Interest is changing that by making it affordable and accessible for small and medium sized businesses to offer employees a path to financial independence through retirement savings.
Our values are the guiding principles we use to build solutions for plan administrators and participants. They reflect our point of view on what's important and what's right:
In it for customers, autonomous & accountable, outcomes driven, inclusive collaboration, and decisive.

Human Interest is on a mission to ensure that people in all lines of work have access to retirement benefits.
Social Security, our nation's retirement safety net, is projected to be insolvent as soon as 2035, making employer-sponsored 401(k) plans the primary retirement savings vehicle in the U.S. Nearly half of all working Americans are not saving enough for their future because they are employed by a company that doesn't offer a retirement plan. Human Interest is changing that by making it affordable and accessible for small and medium sized businesses to offer employees a path to financial independence through retirement savings.
Our values are the guiding principles we use to build solutions for plan administrators and participants. They reflect our point of view on what's important and what's right:
In it for customers, autonomous & accountable, outcomes driven, inclusive collaboration, and decisive.
